signal.name: ExampleAnimal::handle-poke
signal.description:
Signal emitted when a remote caller is invoking the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Animal.Poke">Poke()</link> D-Bus method.
If a signal handler returns %TRUE, it means the signal handler will handle the invocation (e.g. take a reference to @invocation and eventually call example_animal_complete_poke() or e.g. g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() on it) and no order signal handlers will run. If no signal handler handles the invocation, the %G_DBUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN_METHOD error is returned.
Since: 2.30
signal.return: %TRUE if the invocation was handled, %FALSE to let other signal handlers run.

signal.return: %TRUE if the invocation was handled, %FALSE to let other signal handlers run.

signal.name: GApplication::command-line

signal.return: An integer that is set as the exit status for the calling process. See g_application_command_line_set_exit_status().

signal.name: GApplication::shutdown
signal.description: The ::shutdown signal is emitted only on the registered primary instance immediately after the main loop terminates.

signal.name: GApplication::startup
signal.description: The ::startup signal is emitted on the primary instance immediately after registration. See g_application_register().

enum.name: GApplicationFlags
enum.description:
Flags used to define the behaviour of a #GApplication.
Since: 2.28

parameter.name: G_APPLICATION_IS_SERVICE
parameter.parameter_description: Run as a service. In this mode, registration fails if the service is already running, and the application will initially wait up to 10 seconds for an initial activation message to arrive.

parameter.name: G_APPLICATION_IS_LAUNCHER
parameter.parameter_description: Don't try to become the primary instance.

parameter.name: G_APPLICATION_HANDLES_OPEN
parameter.parameter_description: This application handles opening files (in the primary instance). Note that this flag only affects the default implementation of local_command_line(), and has no effect if %G_APPLICATION_HANDLES_COMMAND_LINE is given. See g_application_run() for details.

parameter.name: G_APPLICATION_HANDLES_COMMAND_LINE
parameter.parameter_description: This application handles command line arguments (in the primary instance). Note that this flag only affect the default implementation of local_command_line(). See g_application_run() for details.

parameter.name: G_APPLICATION_SEND_ENVIRONMENT
parameter.parameter_description: Send the environment of the launching process to the primary instance. Set this flag if your application is expected to behave differently depending on certain environment variables. For instance, an editor might be expected to use the <envar>GIT_COMMITTER_NAME</envar> environment variable when editing a git commit message. The environment is available to the #GApplication::command-line signal handler, via g_application_command_line_getenv().

parameter.name: G_APPLICATION_NON_UNIQUE
parameter.parameter_description: Make no attempts to do any of the typical single-instance application negotiation, even if the application ID is given. The application neither attempts to become the owner of the application ID nor does it check if an existing owner already exists. Everything occurs in the local process. Since: 2.30.

signal.name: GDBusConnection::closed
signal.description:
Emitted when the connection is closed.
The cause of this event can be <itemizedlist> <listitem><para> If g_dbus_connection_close() is called. In this case @remote_peer_vanished is set to %FALSE and @error is %NULL. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> If the remote peer closes the connection. In this case @remote_peer_vanished is set to %TRUE and @error is set. </para></listitem> <listitem><para> If the remote peer sends invalid or malformed data. In this case @remote_peer_vanished is set to %FALSE and @error is set. </para></listitem> </itemizedlist>
Upon receiving this signal, you should give up your reference to @connection. You are guaranteed that this signal is emitted only once.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: remote_peer_vanished
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @connection is closed because the remote peer closed its end of the connection.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: A #GError with more details about the event or %NULL.

enum.name: GDBusConnectionFlags
enum.description:
Flags used when creating a new #GDBusConnection.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: G_DBUS_CONNECTION_FLAGS_AUTHENTICATION_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS
parameter.parameter_description: When authenticating as a server, allow the anonymous authentication method.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_CONNECTION_FLAGS_MESSAGE_BUS_CONNECTION
parameter.parameter_description: Pass this flag if connecting to a peer that is a message bus. This means that the Hello() method will be invoked as part of the connection setup.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_CONNECTION_FLAGS_DELAY_MESSAGE_PROCESSING
parameter.parameter_description: If set, processing of D-Bus messages is delayed until g_dbus_connection_start_message_processing() is called.

enum.name: GDBusError
enum.description:
Error codes for the %G_DBUS_ERROR error domain.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: A generic error; "something went wrong" - see the error message for more.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_NO_MEMORY
parameter.parameter_description: There was not enough memory to complete an operation.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SERVICE_UNKNOWN
parameter.parameter_description: The bus doesn't know how to launch a service to supply the bus name you wanted.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_NAME_HAS_NO_OWNER
parameter.parameter_description: The bus name you referenced doesn't exist (i.e. no application owns it).

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_NO_REPLY
parameter.parameter_description: No reply to a message expecting one, usually means a timeout occurred.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_IO_ERROR
parameter.parameter_description: Something went wrong reading or writing to a socket, for example.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_BAD_ADDRESS
parameter.parameter_description: A D-Bus bus address was malformed.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED
parameter.parameter_description: Requested operation isn't supported (like ENOSYS on UNIX).

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_ACCESS_DENIED
parameter.parameter_description: Security restrictions don't allow doing what you're trying to do.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_NO_SERVER
parameter.parameter_description: Unable to connect to server (probably caused by ECONNREFUSED on a socket).

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_TIMEOUT
parameter.parameter_description: Certain timeout errors, possibly ETIMEDOUT on a socket. Note that %G_DBUS_ERROR_NO_REPLY is used for message reply timeouts. Warning: this is confusingly-named given that %G_DBUS_ERROR_TIMED_OUT also exists. We can't fix it for compatibility reasons so just be careful.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_NO_NETWORK
parameter.parameter_description: No network access (probably ENETUNREACH on a socket).

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_ADDRESS_IN_USE
parameter.parameter_description: Can't bind a socket since its address is in use (i.e. EADDRINUSE).

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_DISCONNECTED
parameter.parameter_description: The connection is disconnected and you're trying to use it.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_INVALID_ARGS
parameter.parameter_description: Invalid arguments passed to a method call.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_FILE_EXISTS
parameter.parameter_description: Existing file and the operation you're using does not silently overwrite.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN_METHOD
parameter.parameter_description: Method name you invoked isn't known by the object you invoked it on.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_TIMED_OUT
parameter.parameter_description: Certain timeout errors, e.g. while starting a service. Warning: this is confusingly-named given that %G_DBUS_ERROR_TIMEOUT also exists. We can't fix it for compatibility reasons so just be careful.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_MATCH_RULE_NOT_FOUND
parameter.parameter_description: Tried to remove or modify a match rule that didn't exist.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_MATCH_RULE_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: The match rule isn't syntactically valid.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_EXEC_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: While starting a new process, the exec() call failed.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_FORK_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: While starting a new process, the fork() call failed.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_CHILD_EXITED
parameter.parameter_description: While starting a new process, the child exited with a status code.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_CHILD_SIGNALED
parameter.parameter_description: While starting a new process, the child exited on a signal.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: While starting a new process, something went wrong.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_SETUP_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: We failed to setup the environment correctly.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_CONFIG_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: We failed to setup the config parser correctly.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_SERVICE_NOT_FOUND
parameter.parameter_description: Service file not found in system-services directory.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_PERMISSIONS_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: Permissions are incorrect on the setuid helper.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_FILE_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: Service file invalid (Name, User or Exec missing).

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SPAWN_NO_MEMORY
parameter.parameter_description: Tried to get a UNIX process ID and it wasn't available.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_UNIX_PROCESS_ID_UNKNOWN
parameter.parameter_description: Tried to get a UNIX process ID and it wasn't available.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_INVALID_SIGNATURE
parameter.parameter_description: A type signature is not valid.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_INVALID_FILE_CONTENT
parameter.parameter_description: A file contains invalid syntax or is otherwise broken.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_SELINUX_SECURITY_CONTEXT_UNKNOWN
parameter.parameter_description: Asked for SELinux security context and it wasn't available.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_ADT_AUDIT_DATA_UNKNOWN
parameter.parameter_description: Asked for ADT audit data and it wasn't available.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_ERROR_OBJECT_PATH_IN_USE
parameter.parameter_description: There's already an object with the requested object path.

signal.name: GDBusInterfaceSkeleton::g-authorize-method
signal.description:
Emitted when a method is invoked by a remote caller and used to determine if the method call is authorized.
Note that this signal is emitted in a thread dedicated to handling the method call so handlers are allowed to perform blocking IO. This means that it is appropriate to call e.g. <ulink url="http://hal.freedesktop.org/docs/polkit/PolkitAuthority.html#polkit-authority-check-authorization-sync">polkit_authority_check_authorization_sync()</ulink> with the <ulink url="http://hal.freedesktop.org/docs/polkit/PolkitAuthority.html#POLKIT-CHECK-AUTHORIZATION-FLAGS-ALLOW-USER-INTERACTION:CAPS">POLKIT_CHECK_AUTHORIZATION_FLAGS_ALLOW_USER_INTERACTION</ulink> flag set.
If %FALSE is returned then no further handlers are run and the signal handler must take a reference to @invocation and finish handling the call (e.g. return an error via g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error()).
Otherwise, if %TRUE is returned, signal emission continues. If no handlers return %FALSE, then the method is dispatched. If @interface has an enclosing #GDBusObjectSkeleton, then the #GDBusObjectSkeleton::authorize-method signal handlers run before the handlers for this signal.
The default class handler just returns %TRUE.
Please note that the common case is optimized: if no signals handlers are connected and the default class handler isn't overridden (for both @interface and the enclosing #GDBusObjectSkeleton, if any) and #GDBusInterfaceSkeleton:g-flags does not have the %G_DBUS_INTERFACE_SKELETON_FLAGS_HANDLE_METHOD_INVOCATIONS_IN_THREAD flags set, no dedicated thread is ever used and the call will be handled in the same thread as the object that @interface belongs to was exported in.
Since: 2.30
signal.return: %TRUE if the call is authorized, %FALSE otherwise.

enum.name: GDBusInterfaceSkeletonFlags
enum.description:
Flags describing the behavior of a #GDBusInterfaceSkeleton instance.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: G_DBUS_INTERFACE_SKELETON_FLAGS_HANDLE_METHOD_INVOCATIONS_IN_THREAD
parameter.parameter_description: Each method invocation is handled in a thread dedicated to the invocation. This means that the method implementation can use blocking IO without blocking any other part of the process. It also means that the method implementation must use locking to access data structures used by other threads.

Enumeration used to describe the byte order of a D-Bus message.

signal.name: GDBusObjectManagerClient::interface-proxy-properties-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when one or more D-Bus properties on proxy changes. The local cache has already been updated when this signal fires. Note that both @changed_properties and @invalidated_properties are guaranteed to never be %NULL (either may be empty though).
This signal exists purely as a convenience to avoid having to connect signals to all interface proxies managed by @manager.
This signal is emitted in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> that @manager was constructed in.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: object_proxy
parameter.parameter_description: The #GDBusObjectProxy on which an interface has properties that are changing.

parameter.name: interface_proxy
parameter.parameter_description: The #GDBusProxy that has properties that are changing.

parameter.name: changed_properties
parameter.parameter_description: A #GVariant containing the properties that changed.

parameter.name: invalidated_properties
parameter.parameter_description: A %NULL terminated array of properties that was invalidated.

signal.description:
Emitted when a D-Bus signal is received on @interface_proxy.
This signal exists purely as a convenience to avoid having to connect signals to all interface proxies managed by @manager.
This signal is emitted in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> that @manager was constructed in.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: object_proxy
parameter.parameter_description: The #GDBusObjectProxy on which an interface is emitting a D-Bus signal.

parameter.name: interface_proxy
parameter.parameter_description: The #GDBusProxy that is emitting a D-Bus signal.

parameter.name: sender_name

parameter.name: parameters

parameter.parameter_description: If not set and the manager is for a well-known name, then request the bus to launch an owner for the name if no-one owns the name. This flag can only be used in managers for well-known names.

signal.name: GDBusObjectSkeleton::authorize-method
signal.description:
Emitted when a method is invoked by a remote caller and used to determine if the method call is authorized.
This signal is like #GDBusInterfaceSkeleton<!-- -->'s #GDBusInterfaceSkeleton::g-authorize-method signal, except that it is for the enclosing object.
The default class handler just returns %TRUE.
Since: 2.30
signal.return: %TRUE if the call is authorized, %FALSE otherwise.

enum.name: GDBusPropertyInfoFlags
enum.description:
Flags describing the access control of a D-Bus property.
Since: 2.26

signal.name: GDBusProxy::g-properties-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when one or more D-Bus properties on @proxy changes. The local cache has already been updated when this signal fires. Note that both @changed_properties and @invalidated_properties are guaranteed to never be %NULL (either may be empty though).
If the proxy has the flag %G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_GET_INVALIDATED_PROPERTIES set, then @invalidated_properties will always be empty.
This signal corresponds to the <literal>PropertiesChanged</literal> D-Bus signal on the <literal>org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties</literal> interface.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: changed_properties
parameter.parameter_description: A #GVariant containing the properties that changed

parameter.name: invalidated_properties
parameter.parameter_description: A %NULL terminated array of properties that was invalidated

signal.name: GDBusProxy::g-signal
signal.description:
Emitted when a signal from the remote object and interface that @proxy is for, has been received.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: sender_name
parameter.parameter_description: The sender of the signal or %NULL if the connection is not a bus connection.

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.parameter_description: A #GVariant tuple with parameters for the signal.

enum.name: GDBusProxyFlags
enum.description:
Flags used when constructing an instance of a #GDBusProxy derived class.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_CONNECT_SIGNALS
parameter.parameter_description: Don't connect to signals on the remote object.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_AUTO_START
parameter.parameter_description: If not set and the proxy if for a well-known name, then request the bus to launch an owner for the name if no-one owns the name. This flag can only be used in proxies for well-known names.

parameter.name: G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_GET_INVALIDATED_PROPERTIES
parameter.parameter_description: If set, the property value for any <emphasis>invalidated property</emphasis> will be (asynchronously) retrieved upon receiving the <ulink url="http://dbus.freedesktop.org/doc/dbus-specification.html#standard-interfaces-properties">PropertiesChanged</ulink> D-Bus signal and the property will not cause emission of the #GDBusProxy::g-properties-changed signal. When the value is received the #GDBusProxy::g-properties-changed signal is emitted for the property along with the retrieved value. Since 2.32.

enum.name: GDBusSendMessageFlags
enum.description:
Flags used when sending #GDBusMessage<!-- -->s on a #GDBusConnection.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: G_DBUS_SEND_MESSAGE_FLAGS_PRESERVE_SERIAL
parameter.parameter_description: Do not automatically assign a serial number from the #GDBusConnection object when sending a message.

signal.name: GDBusServer::new-connection
signal.description:
Emitted when a new authenticated connection has been made. Use g_dbus_connection_get_peer_credentials() to figure out what identity (if any), was authenticated.
If you want to accept the connection, take a reference to the @connection object and return %TRUE. When you are done with the connection call g_dbus_connection_close() and give up your reference. Note that the other peer may disconnect at any time - a typical thing to do when accepting a connection is to listen to the #GDBusConnection::closed signal.
If #GDBusServer:flags contains %G_DBUS_SERVER_FLAGS_RUN_IN_THREAD then the signal is emitted in a new thread dedicated to the connection. Otherwise the signal is emitted in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread that @server was constructed in.
You are guaranteed that signal handlers for this signal runs before incoming messages on @connection are processed. This means that it's suitable to call g_dbus_connection_register_object() or similar from the signal handler.
Since: 2.26
signal.return: %TRUE to claim @connection, %FALSE to let other handlers run.

enum.name: GDBusServerFlags
enum.description:
Flags used when creating a #GDBusServer.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: G_DBUS_SERVER_FLAGS_RUN_IN_THREAD
parameter.parameter_description: All #GDBusServer::new-connection signals will run in separated dedicated threads (see signal for details).

enum.name: GDBusSignalFlags
enum.description:
Flags used when subscribing to signals via g_dbus_connection_signal_subscribe().
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: G_DBUS_SIGNAL_FLAGS_NO_MATCH_RULE
parameter.parameter_description: Don't actually send the AddMatch D-Bus call for this signal subscription. This gives you more control over which match rules you add (but you must add them manually).

enum.name: GDBusSubtreeFlags
enum.description:
Flags passed to g_dbus_connection_register_subtree().
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: G_DBUS_SUBTREE_FLAGS_DISPATCH_TO_UNENUMERATED_NODES
parameter.parameter_description: Method calls to objects not in the enumerated range will still be dispatched. This is useful if you want to dynamically spawn objects in the subtree.

parameter.name: G_DATA_STREAM_NEWLINE_TYPE_ANY

You can think of it as "unlink destination" before writing to it, although the implementation may not be exactly like that. Since 2.20

signal.description:
Emitted when @file has been changed.
If using #G_FILE_MONITOR_SEND_MOVED flag and @event_type is #G_FILE_MONITOR_EVENT_MOVED, @file will be set to a #GFile containing the old path, and @other_file will be set to a #GFile containing the new path.
In all the other cases, @other_file will be set to #NULL.

signal.name: GMenuModel::items-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when a change has occured to the menu.
The only changes that can occur to a menu is that items are removed or added. Items may not change (except by being removed and added back in the same location). This signal is capable of describing both of those changes (at the same time).
The signal means that starting at the index @position, @removed items were removed and @added items were added in their place. If @removed is zero then only items were added. If @added is zero then only items were removed.
As an example, if the menu contains items a, b, c, d (in that order) and the signal (2, 1, 3) occurs then the new composition of the menu will be a, b, _, _, _, d (with each _ representing some new item).
Signal handlers may query the model (particularly the added items) and expect to see the results of the modification that is being reported. The signal is emitted after the modification.

signal.name: GMount::changed
signal.description: Emitted when the mount has been changed.

parameter.name: mount
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

This signal is emitted when the #GMount is about to be unmounted.

signal.description: This signal is emitted when the #GMount have been unmounted. If the recipient is holding references to the object they should release them so the object can be finalized.

parameter.name: mount
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

enum.name: GMountMountFlags
enum.description: Flags used when mounting a mount.

signal.name: GMountOperation::aborted
signal.description:
Emitted by the backend when e.g. a device becomes unavailable while a mount operation is in progress.
Implementations of GMountOperation should handle this signal by dismissing open password dialogs.
Since: 2.20

signal.name: GMountOperation::ask-password
signal.description:
Emitted when a mount operation asks the user for a password.
If the message contains a line break, the first line should be presented as a heading. For example, it may be used as the primary text in a #GtkMessageDialog.

parameter.name: message
parameter.parameter_description: string containing a message to display to the user.

parameter.name: default_user
parameter.parameter_description: string containing the default user name.

signal.name: GMountOperation::ask-question
signal.description:
Emitted when asking the user a question and gives a list of choices for the user to choose from.
If the message contains a line break, the first line should be presented as a heading. For example, it may be used as the primary text in a #GtkMessageDialog.

parameter.name: message
parameter.parameter_description: string containing a message to display to the user.

parameter.name: choices
parameter.parameter_description: an array of strings for each possible choice.

signal.name: GMountOperation::reply
signal.description: Emitted when the user has replied to the mount operation.

parameter.name: result
parameter.parameter_description: a #GMountOperationResult indicating how the request was handled

signal.name: GMountOperation::show-processes
signal.description:
Emitted when one or more processes are blocking an operation e.g. unmounting/ejecting a #GMount or stopping a #GDrive.
Note that this signal may be emitted several times to update the list of blocking processes as processes close files. The application should only respond with g_mount_operation_reply() to the latest signal (setting #GMountOperation:choice to the choice the user made).
If the message contains a line break, the first line should be presented as a heading. For example, it may be used as the primary text in a #GtkMessageDialog.
Since: 2.22

parameter.name: message
parameter.parameter_description: string containing a message to display to the user.

parameter.name: processes
parameter.parameter_description: an array of #GPid for processes blocking the operation.

parameter.name: choices
parameter.parameter_description: an array of strings for each possible choice.

signal.name: GMountOperation::show-unmount-progress
signal.description:
Emitted when an unmount operation has been busy for more than some time (typically 1.5 seconds).
When unmounting or ejecting a volume, the kernel might need to flush pending data in its buffers to the volume stable storage, and this operation can take a considerable amount of time. This signal may be emitted several times as long as the unmount operation is outstanding, and then one last time when the operation is completed, with @bytes_left set to zero.
Implementations of GMountOperation should handle this signal by showing an UI notification, and then dismiss it, or show another notification of completion, when @bytes_left reaches zero.
If the message contains a line break, the first line should be presented as a heading. For example, it may be used as the primary text in a #GtkMessageDialog.
Since: 2.34

parameter.name: message
parameter.parameter_description: string containing a mesage to display to the user

parameter.name: time_left
parameter.parameter_description: the estimated time left before the operation completes, in microseconds, or -1

parameter.name: bytes_left
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of bytes to be written before the operation completes (or -1 if such amount is not known), or zero if the operation is completed

enum.name: GMountOperationResult
enum.description: #GMountOperationResult is returned as a result when a request for information is send by the mounting operation.

parameter.name: G_MOUNT_OPERATION_HANDLED
parameter.parameter_description: The request was fulfilled and the user specified data is now available

parameter.name: G_MOUNT_OPERATION_ABORTED
parameter.parameter_description: The user requested the mount operation to be aborted

parameter.name: G_MOUNT_OPERATION_UNHANDLED
parameter.parameter_description: The request was unhandled (i.e. not implemented)

enum.name: GMountUnmountFlags

parameter.name: G_MOUNT_UNMOUNT_FORCE

signal.name: GResolver::reload
signal.description: Emitted when the resolver notices that the system resolver configuration has changed.

enum.name: GResolverError
enum.description:
An error code used with %G_RESOLVER_ERROR in a #GError returned from a #GResolver routine.
Since: 2.22

parameter.name: G_RESOLVER_ERROR_NOT_FOUND
parameter.parameter_description: the requested name/address/service was not found

parameter.name: G_RESOLVER_ERROR_TEMPORARY_FAILURE
parameter.parameter_description: the requested information could not be looked up due to a network error or similar problem

enum.name: GResolverRecordType
enum.description:
The type of record that g_resolver_lookup_records() or g_resolver_lookup_records_async() should retrieve. The records are returned as lists of #GVariant tuples. Each record type has different values in the variant tuples returned.
%G_RESOLVER_RECORD_SRV records are returned as variants with the signature '(qqqs)', containing a guint16 with the priority, a guint16 with the weight, a guint16 with the port, and a string of the hostname.
%G_RESOLVER_RECORD_MX records are returned as variants with the signature '(qs)', representing a guint16 with the preference, and a string containing the mail exchanger hostname.
%G_RESOLVER_RECORD_TXT records are returned as variants with the signature '(as)', representing an array of the strings in the text record.
%G_RESOLVER_RECORD_SOA records are returned as variants with the signature '(ssuuuuu)', representing a string containing the primary name server, a string containing the administrator, the serial as a guint32, the refresh interval as guint32, the retry interval as a guint32, the expire timeout as a guint32, and the ttl as a guint32.
%G_RESOLVER_RECORD_NS records are returned as variants with the signature '(s)', representing a string of the hostname of the name server.
Since: 2.34

parameter.name: G_RESOLVER_RECORD_SRV
parameter.parameter_description: lookup DNS SRV records for a domain

parameter.name: G_RESOLVER_RECORD_MX
parameter.parameter_description: lookup DNS MX records for a domain

parameter.name: G_RESOLVER_RECORD_TXT
parameter.parameter_description: lookup DNS TXT records for a name

parameter.name: G_RESOLVER_RECORD_SOA
parameter.parameter_description: lookup DNS SOA records for a zone

parameter.name: G_RESOLVER_RECORD_NS
parameter.parameter_description: lookup DNS NS records for a domain

enum.name: GResourceError
enum.description:
An error code used with %G_RESOURCE_ERROR in a #GError returned from a #GResource routine.
Since: 2.32

parameter.name: G_RESOURCE_ERROR_NOT_FOUND
parameter.parameter_description: no file was found at the requested path

enum.name: GResourceFlags
enum.description:
GResourceFlags give information about a particular file inside a resource bundle.
Since: 2.32

enum.name: GResourceLookupFlags
enum.description:
GResourceLookupFlags determine how resource path lookups are handled.
Since: 2.32

signal.name: GSettings::change-event
signal.description:
The "change-event" signal is emitted once per change event that affects this settings object. You should connect to this signal only if you are interested in viewing groups of changes before they are split out into multiple emissions of the "changed" signal. For most use cases it is more appropriate to use the "changed" signal.
In the event that the change event applies to one or more specified keys, @keys will be an array of #GQuark of length @n_keys. In the event that the change event applies to the #GSettings object as a whole (ie: potentially every key has been changed) then @keys will be %NULL and @n_keys will be 0.
The default handler for this signal invokes the "changed" signal for each affected key. If any other connected handler returns %TRUE then this default functionality will be suppressed.

parameter.name: settings
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: keys
parameter.parameter_description: an array of #GQuark<!-- -->s for the changed keys, or %NULL

parameter.name: n_keys
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the @keys array, or 0

signal.return: %TRUE to stop other handlers from being invoked for the event. FALSE to propagate the event further.

signal.name: GSettings::changed
signal.description:
The "changed" signal is emitted when a key has potentially changed. You should call one of the g_settings_get() calls to check the new value.
This signal supports detailed connections. You can connect to the detailed signal "changed::x" in order to only receive callbacks when key "x" changes.

parameter.name: settings
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: key
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the key that changed

signal.name: GSettings::writable-change-event
signal.description:
The "writable-change-event" signal is emitted once per writability change event that affects this settings object. You should connect to this signal if you are interested in viewing groups of changes before they are split out into multiple emissions of the "writable-changed" signal. For most use cases it is more appropriate to use the "writable-changed" signal.
In the event that the writability change applies only to a single key, @key will be set to the #GQuark for that key. In the event that the writability change affects the entire settings object, @key will be 0.
The default handler for this signal invokes the "writable-changed" and "changed" signals for each affected key. This is done because changes in writability might also imply changes in value (if for example, a new mandatory setting is introduced). If any other connected handler returns %TRUE then this default functionality will be suppressed.

parameter.name: settings
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: key
parameter.parameter_description: the quark of the key, or 0

signal.return: %TRUE to stop other handlers from being invoked for the event. FALSE to propagate the event further.

signal.name: GSettings::writable-changed
signal.description:
The "writable-changed" signal is emitted when the writability of a key has potentially changed. You should call g_settings_is_writable() in order to determine the new status.
This signal supports detailed connections. You can connect to the detailed signal "writable-changed::x" in order to only receive callbacks when the writability of "x" changes.

parameter.name: settings
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

enum.name: GSettingsBindFlags
enum.description: Flags used when creating a binding. These flags determine in which direction the binding works. The default is to synchronize in both directions.

parameter.name: G_SETTINGS_BIND_GET
parameter.parameter_description: Update the #GObject property when the setting changes. It is an error to use this flag if the property is not writable.

parameter.name: G_SETTINGS_BIND_SET
parameter.parameter_description: Update the setting when the #GObject property changes. It is an error to use this flag if the property is not readable.

parameter.name: G_SETTINGS_BIND_NO_SENSITIVITY
parameter.parameter_description: Do not try to bind a "sensitivity" property to the writability of the setting

parameter.name: G_SETTINGS_BIND_GET_NO_CHANGES
parameter.parameter_description: When set in addition to #G_SETTINGS_BIND_GET, set the #GObject property value initially from the setting, but do not listen for changes of the setting

parameter.name: G_SETTINGS_BIND_INVERT_BOOLEAN
parameter.parameter_description: When passed to g_settings_bind(), uses a pair of mapping functions that invert the boolean value when mapping between the setting and the property. The setting and property must both be booleans. You cannot pass this flag to g_settings_bind_with_mapping().

signal.name: GSimpleAction::activate
GSimpleAction::change-state

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the requested value for the state

signal.name: GSocketClient::event
signal.description:
Emitted when @client's activity on @connectable changes state. Among other things, this can be used to provide progress information about a network connection in the UI. The meanings of the different @event values are as follows:
<variablelist> <varlistentry> <term>%G_SOCKET_CLIENT_RESOLVING:</term> <listitem><para> @client is about to look up @connectable in DNS. @connection will be %NULL. </para></listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term>%G_SOCKET_CLIENT_RESOLVED:</term> <listitem><para> @client has successfully resolved @connectable in DNS. @connection will be %NULL. </para></listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term>%G_SOCKET_CLIENT_CONNECTING:</term> <listitem><para> @client is about to make a connection to a remote host; either a proxy server or the destination server itself. @connection is the #GSocketConnection, which is not yet connected. </para></listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term>%G_SOCKET_CLIENT_CONNECTED:</term> <listitem><para> @client has successfully connected to a remote host. @connection is the connected #GSocketConnection. </para></listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term>%G_SOCKET_CLIENT_PROXY_NEGOTIATING:</term> <listitem><para> @client is about to negotiate with a proxy to get it to connect to @connectable. @connection is the #GSocketConnection to the proxy server. </para></listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term>%G_SOCKET_CLIENT_PROXY_NEGOTIATED:</term> <listitem><para> @client has negotiated a connection to @connectable through a proxy server. @connection is the stream returned from g_proxy_connect(), which may or may not be a #GSocketConnection. </para></listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term>%G_SOCKET_CLIENT_TLS_HANDSHAKING:</term> <listitem><para> @client is about to begin a TLS handshake. @connection is a #GTlsClientConnection. </para></listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term>%G_SOCKET_CLIENT_TLS_HANDSHAKED:</term> <listitem><para> @client has successfully completed the TLS handshake. @connection is a #GTlsClientConnection. </para></listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term>%G_SOCKET_CLIENT_COMPLETE:</term> <listitem><para> @client has either successfully connected to @connectable (in which case @connection is the #GSocketConnection that it will be returning to the caller) or has failed (in which case @connection is %NULL and the client is about to return an error). </para></listitem> </varlistentry> </variablelist>
Each event except %G_SOCKET_CLIENT_COMPLETE may be emitted multiple times (or not at all) for a given connectable (in particular, if @client ends up attempting to connect to more than one address). However, if @client emits the #GSocketClient::event signal at all for a given connectable, that it will always emit it with %G_SOCKET_CLIENT_COMPLETE when it is done.
Note that there may be additional #GSocketClientEvent values in the future; unrecognized @event values should be ignored.
Since: 2.32

parameter.name: connection
parameter.parameter_description: the current representation of the connection

enum.name: GSocketClientEvent
enum.description:
Describes an event occurring on a #GSocketClient. See the #GSocketClient::event signal for more details.
Additional values may be added to this type in the future.
Since: 2.32

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_CLIENT_RESOLVING
parameter.parameter_description: The client is doing a DNS lookup.

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_CLIENT_RESOLVED
parameter.parameter_description: The client has completed a DNS lookup.

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_CLIENT_CONNECTING
parameter.parameter_description: The client is connecting to a remote host (either a proxy or the destination server).

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_CLIENT_CONNECTED
parameter.parameter_description: The client has connected to a remote host.

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_CLIENT_PROXY_NEGOTIATING
parameter.parameter_description: The client is negotiating with a proxy to connect to the destination server.

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_CLIENT_PROXY_NEGOTIATED
parameter.parameter_description: The client has negotiated with the proxy server.

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_CLIENT_TLS_HANDSHAKING
parameter.parameter_description: The client is performing a TLS handshake.

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_CLIENT_TLS_HANDSHAKED
parameter.parameter_description: The client has performed a TLS handshake.

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_CLIENT_COMPLETE
parameter.parameter_description: The client is done with a particular #GSocketConnectable.

enum.name: GSocketFamily
enum.description:
The protocol family of a #GSocketAddress. (These values are identical to the system defines %AF_INET, %AF_INET6 and %AF_UNIX, if available.)
Since: 2.22

enum.name: GSocketMsgFlags
enum.description:
Flags used in g_socket_receive_message() and g_socket_send_message(). The flags listed in the enum are some commonly available flags, but the values used for them are the same as on the platform, and any other flags are passed in/out as is. So to use a platform specific flag, just include the right system header and pass in the flag.
Since: 2.22

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_MSG_OOB
parameter.parameter_description: Request to send/receive out of band data.

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_MSG_PEEK
parameter.parameter_description: Read data from the socket without removing it from the queue.

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_MSG_DONTROUTE
parameter.parameter_description: Don't use a gateway to send out the packet, only send to hosts on directly connected networks.

enum.name: GSocketProtocol
enum.description:
A protocol identifier is specified when creating a #GSocket, which is a family/type specific identifier, where 0 means the default protocol for the particular family/type.
This enum contains a set of commonly available and used protocols. You can also pass any other identifiers handled by the platform in order to use protocols not listed here.
Since: 2.22

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_PROTOCOL_DEFAULT
parameter.parameter_description: The default protocol for the family/type

signal.name: GSocketService::incoming
signal.return: %TRUE to stop other handlers from being called

enum.name: GSocketType
enum.description:
Flags used when creating a #GSocket. Some protocols may not implement all the socket types.
Since: 2.22

parameter.name: G_SOCKET_TYPE_SEQPACKET
parameter.parameter_description: Reliable connection-based passing of datagrams of fixed maximum length (e.g. SCTP).

enum.name: GTestDBusFlags
enum.description:
Flags to define future #GTestDBus behaviour.
Since: 2.34

signal.name: GThreadedSocketService::run
signal.description: The ::run signal is emitted in a worker thread in response to an incoming connection. This thread is dedicated to handling @connection and may perform blocking IO. The signal handler need not return until the connection is closed.
signal.return: %TRUE to stop further signal handlers from being called

enum.name: GTlsAuthenticationMode
enum.description:
The client authentication mode for a #GTlsServerConnection.
Since: 2.28

enum.name: GTlsCertificateFlags
enum.description:
A set of flags describing TLS certification validation. This can be used to set which validation steps to perform (eg, with g_tls_client_connection_set_validation_flags()), or to describe why a particular certificate was rejected (eg, in #GTlsConnection::accept-certificate).
Since: 2.28

parameter.name: G_TLS_CERTIFICATE_UNKNOWN_CA
parameter.parameter_description: The signing certificate authority is not known.

parameter.name: G_TLS_CERTIFICATE_BAD_IDENTITY
parameter.parameter_description: The certificate does not match the expected identity of the site that it was retrieved from.

parameter.name: G_TLS_CERTIFICATE_NOT_ACTIVATED
parameter.parameter_description: The certificate's activation time is still in the future

parameter.name: G_TLS_CERTIFICATE_REVOKED
parameter.parameter_description: The certificate has been revoked according to the #GTlsConnection's certificate revocation list.

parameter.name: G_TLS_CERTIFICATE_INSECURE
parameter.parameter_description: The certificate's algorithm is considered insecure.

parameter.name: G_TLS_CERTIFICATE_GENERIC_ERROR
parameter.parameter_description: Some other error occurred validating the certificate

parameter.name: G_TLS_CERTIFICATE_VALIDATE_ALL
parameter.parameter_description: the combination of all of the above flags

signal.name: GTlsConnection::accept-certificate
signal.description:
Emitted during the TLS handshake after the peer certificate has been received. You can examine @peer_cert's certification path by calling g_tls_certificate_get_issuer() on it.
For a client-side connection, @peer_cert is the server's certificate, and the signal will only be emitted if the certificate was not acceptable according to @conn's #GTlsClientConnection:validation_flags. If you would like the certificate to be accepted despite @errors, return %TRUE from the signal handler. Otherwise, if no handler accepts the certificate, the handshake will fail with %G_TLS_ERROR_BAD_CERTIFICATE.
For a server-side connection, @peer_cert is the certificate presented by the client, if this was requested via the server's #GTlsServerConnection:authentication_mode. On the server side, the signal is always emitted when the client presents a certificate, and the certificate will only be accepted if a handler returns %TRUE.
Note that if this signal is emitted as part of asynchronous I/O in the main thread, then you should not attempt to interact with the user before returning from the signal handler. If you want to let the user decide whether or not to accept the certificate, you would have to return %FALSE from the signal handler on the first attempt, and then after the connection attempt returns a %G_TLS_ERROR_HANDSHAKE, you can interact with the user, and if the user decides to accept the certificate, remember that fact, create a new connection, and return %TRUE from the signal handler the next time.
If you are doing I/O in another thread, you do not need to worry about this, and can simply block in the signal handler until the UI thread returns an answer.
Since: 2.28
signal.return: %TRUE to accept @peer_cert (which will also immediately end the signal emission). %FALSE to allow the signal emission to continue, which will cause the handshake to fail if no one else overrides it.

enum.name: GTlsDatabaseLookupFlags
enum.description:
Flags for g_tls_database_lookup_certificate_handle(), g_tls_database_lookup_certificate_issuer(), and g_tls_database_lookup_certificates_issued_by().
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: G_TLS_DATABASE_LOOKUP_KEYPAIR
parameter.parameter_description: Restrict lookup to certificates that have a private key.

enum.name: GTlsDatabaseVerifyFlags
enum.description:
Flags for g_tls_database_verify_chain().
Since: 2.30

enum.name: GTlsError
enum.description:
An error code used with %G_TLS_ERROR in a #GError returned from a TLS-related routine.
Since: 2.28

parameter.name: G_TLS_ERROR_BAD_CERTIFICATE
parameter.parameter_description: A certificate could not be parsed

parameter.name: G_TLS_ERROR_NOT_TLS
parameter.parameter_description: The TLS handshake failed because the peer does not seem to be a TLS server.

parameter.name: G_TLS_ERROR_HANDSHAKE
parameter.parameter_description: The TLS handshake failed because the peer's certificate was not acceptable.

parameter.name: G_TLS_ERROR_CERTIFICATE_REQUIRED
parameter.parameter_description: The TLS handshake failed because the server requested a client-side certificate, but none was provided. See g_tls_connection_set_certificate().

parameter.name: G_TLS_ERROR_EOF
parameter.parameter_description: The TLS connection was closed without proper notice, which may indicate an attack. See g_tls_connection_set_require_close_notify().

enum.name: GTlsInteractionResult
enum.description:
#GTlsInteractionResult is returned by various functions in #GTlsInteraction when finishing an interaction request.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: G_TLS_INTERACTION_UNHANDLED
parameter.parameter_description: The interaction was unhandled (i.e. not implemented).

parameter.name: G_TLS_INTERACTION_HANDLED
parameter.parameter_description: The interaction completed, and resulting data is available.

parameter.name: G_TLS_INTERACTION_FAILED
parameter.parameter_description: The interaction has failed, or was cancelled. and the operation should be aborted.

enum.name: GTlsPasswordFlags
enum.description:
Various flags for the password.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: G_TLS_PASSWORD_RETRY
parameter.parameter_description: The password was wrong, and the user should retry.

parameter.name: G_TLS_PASSWORD_MANY_TRIES
parameter.parameter_description: Hint to the user that the password has been wrong many times, and the user may not have many chances left.

parameter.name: G_TLS_PASSWORD_FINAL_TRY
parameter.parameter_description: Hint to the user that this is the last try to get this password right.

enum.name: GTlsRehandshakeMode
enum.description:
When to allow rehandshaking. See g_tls_connection_set_rehandshake_mode().
Since: 2.28

enum.name: GUnixSocketAddressType
enum.description:
The type of name used by a #GUnixSocketAddress. %G_UNIX_SOCKET_ADDRESS_PATH indicates a traditional unix domain socket bound to a filesystem path. %G_UNIX_SOCKET_ADDRESS_ANONYMOUS indicates a socket not bound to any name (eg, a client-side socket, or a socket created with socketpair()).
For abstract sockets, there are two incompatible ways of naming them; the man pages suggest using the entire <literal>struct sockaddr_un</literal> as the name, padding the unused parts of the %sun_path field with zeroes; this corresponds to %G_UNIX_SOCKET_ADDRESS_ABSTRACT_PADDED. However, many programs instead just use a portion of %sun_path, and pass an appropriate smaller length to bind() or connect(). This is %G_UNIX_SOCKET_ADDRESS_ABSTRACT.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: G_UNIX_SOCKET_ADDRESS_ABSTRACT_PADDED
parameter.parameter_description: an abstract name, 0-padded to the full length of a unix socket name

function.name: example_animal_call_poke
function.description:
Asynchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Animal.Poke">Poke()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call example_animal_call_poke_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See example_animal_call_poke_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this method.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: arg_make_sad
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_make_happy
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or %NULL.

function.name: example_animal_call_poke_finish
function.description:
Finishes an operation started with example_animal_call_poke().
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to example_animal_call_poke().

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.name: example_animal_call_poke_sync
function.description:
Synchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Animal.Poke">Poke()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See example_animal_call_poke() for the asynchronous version of this method.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: arg_make_sad
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_make_happy
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.name: example_animal_complete_poke
function.description:
Helper function used in service implementations to finish handling invocations of the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Animal.Poke">Poke()</link> D-Bus method. If you instead want to finish handling an invocation by returning an error, use g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() or similar.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.
Since: 2.30

function.name: example_animal_proxy_new_sync
function.description:
Synchronously creates a proxy for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Animal.top_of_page">org.gtk.GDBus.Example.ObjectManager.Animal</link>. See g_dbus_proxy_new_sync() for more details.
The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See example_animal_proxy_new() for the asynchronous version of this constructor.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A bus name (well-known or unique) or %NULL if @connection is not a message bus connection.

function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: example_animal_set_bar
function.description:
Sets the <link linkend="gdbus-property-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Animal.Bar">"Bar"</link> D-Bus property to @value.
Since this D-Bus property is not writable, it is only meaningful to use this function on the service-side.
Since: 2.36

function.name: example_animal_set_foo
function.description:
Sets the <link linkend="gdbus-property-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Animal.Foo">"Foo"</link> D-Bus property to @value.
Since this D-Bus property is not writable, it is only meaningful to use this function on the service-side.
Since: 2.30

function.name: example_animal_set_mood
function.description:
Sets the <link linkend="gdbus-property-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Animal.Mood">"Mood"</link> D-Bus property to @value.
Since this D-Bus property is not writable, it is only meaningful to use this function on the service-side.
Since: 2.30

function.name: example_animal_skeleton_new
function.description:
Creates a skeleton object for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Animal.top_of_page">org.gtk.GDBus.Example.ObjectManager.Animal</link>.
Since: 2.30
function.return: The skeleton object.

function.name: example_cat_interface_info
function.description: Gets a machine-readable description of the <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Cat.top_of_page">org.gtk.GDBus.Example.ObjectManager.Cat</link> D-Bus interface.
function.return: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo. Do not free.

function.name: example_cat_override_properties
function.description: Overrides all #GObject properties in the #ExampleCat interface for a concrete class. The properties are overridden in the order they are defined.

parameter.name: klass
parameter.parameter_description: The class structure for a #GObject<!-- -->-derived class.

parameter.name: property_id_begin
parameter.parameter_description: The property id to assign to the first overridden property.

function.return: The last property id.

function.name: example_cat_proxy_new
function.description:
Asynchronously creates a proxy for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Cat.top_of_page">org.gtk.GDBus.Example.ObjectManager.Cat</link>. See g_dbus_proxy_new() for more details.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call example_cat_proxy_new_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See example_cat_proxy_new_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this constructor.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A bus name (well-known or unique) or %NULL if @connection is not a message bus connection.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: example_cat_proxy_new_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with example_cat_proxy_new().

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to example_cat_proxy_new().

function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: example_cat_proxy_new_for_bus
function.description:
Like example_cat_proxy_new() but takes a #GBusType instead of a #GDBusConnection.

parameter.name: callback

parameter.name: res

function.name: example_object_get_animal
function.description:
Gets the #ExampleAnimal instance for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Animal.top_of_page">org.gtk.GDBus.Example.ObjectManager.Animal</link> on @object, if any.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #ExampleAnimal that must be freed with g_object_unref() or %NULL if @object does not implement the interface.

function.name: example_object_get_cat
function.description: Gets the #ExampleCat instance for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-gtk-GDBus-Example-ObjectManager-Cat.top_of_page">org.gtk.GDBus.Example.ObjectManager.Cat</link> on @object, if any.
function.return: A #ExampleCat that must be freed with g_object_unref() or %NULL if @object does not implement the interface.

function.name: example_object_manager_client_get_proxy_type
function.description: A #GDBusProxyTypeFunc that maps @interface_name to the generated #GDBusObjectProxy<!-- -->- and #GDBusProxy<!-- -->-derived types.

parameter.name: object_path
parameter.parameter_description: The object path of the remote object (unused).

parameter.name: interface_name
parameter.parameter_description: Interface name of the remote object or %NULL to get the object proxy #GType.

function.return: A #GDBusProxy<!-- -->-derived #GType if @interface_name is not %NULL, otherwise the #GType for #ExampleObjectProxy.

function.name: example_object_manager_client_new
function.description:
Asynchronously creates #GDBusObjectManagerClient using example_object_manager_client_get_proxy_type() as the #GDBusProxyTypeFunc. See g_dbus_object_manager_client_new() for more details.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call example_object_manager_client_new_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See example_object_manager_client_new_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this constructor.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A bus name (well-known or unique) or %NULL if @connection is not a message bus connection.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: example_object_manager_client_new_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with example_object_manager_client_new().

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to example_object_manager_client_new().

function.return: The constructed object manager client or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: example_object_manager_client_new_for_bus

function.name: example_object_peek_animal
function.description:
Like example_object_get_animal() but doesn't increase the reference count on the returned object.
<warning>It is not safe to use the returned object if you are on another thread than the one where the #GDBusObjectManagerClient or #GDBusObjectManagerServer for @object is running.</warning>
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #ExampleAnimal or %NULL if @object does not implement the interface. Do not free the returned object, it is owned by @object.

function.name: example_object_peek_cat
function.description:
Like example_object_get_cat() but doesn't increase the reference count on the returned object.
<warning>It is not safe to use the returned object if you are on another thread than the one where the #GDBusObjectManagerClient or #GDBusObjectManagerServer for @object is running.</warning>
function.return: A #ExampleCat or %NULL if @object does not implement the interface. Do not free the returned object, it is owned by @object.

function.description: Creates a new proxy object.
function.return: The proxy object.

function.name: fen_add
function.description: Won't hold a ref, we have a timout callback to clean unused node_t. If there is no value for a key, add it and return it; else return the old one.

function.name: fen_init
function.description: FEN subsystem initializing.

function.name: foo_igen_authorize_call_check_authorized
function.description:
Asynchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-project-Authorize.CheckAuthorized">CheckAuthorized()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call foo_igen_authorize_call_check_authorized_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See foo_igen_authorize_call_check_authorized_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this method.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or %NULL.

function.name: foo_igen_authorize_call_check_authorized_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with foo_igen_authorize_call_check_authorized().

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to foo_igen_authorize_call_check_authorized().

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.description:

See foo_igen_authorize_call_check_authorized() for the asynchronous version of this method.
function.return: %TRUE if the call succeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.name: foo_igen_authorize_complete_check_authorized
function.description:
Helper function used in service implementations to finish handling invocations of the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-project-Authorize.CheckAuthorized">CheckAuthorized()</link> D-Bus method. If you instead want to finish handling an invocation by returning an error, use g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() or similar.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.

function.description:

If you instead want to finish handling an invocation by returning an error, use g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() or similar.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.

If you instead want to finish handling an invocation by returning an error, use g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() or similar.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.

function.name: foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_interface_info
function.description: Gets a machine-readable description of the <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-project-Bar-Frobnicator.top_of_page">org.project.Bar.Frobnicator</link> D-Bus interface.
function.return: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo. Do not free.

function.name: foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_override_properties
function.description: Overrides all #GObject properties in the #FooiGenBarFrobnicator interface for a concrete class. The properties are overridden in the order they are defined.

parameter.name: klass
parameter.parameter_description: The class structure for a #GObject<!-- -->-derived class.

parameter.name: property_id_begin
parameter.parameter_description: The property id to assign to the first overridden property.

function.return: The last property id.

function.name: foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new
function.description:
Asynchronously creates a proxy for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-project-Bar-Frobnicator.top_of_page">org.project.Bar.Frobnicator</link>. See g_dbus_proxy_new() for more details.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this constructor.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A bus name (well-known or unique) or %NULL if @connection is not a message bus connection.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new().

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new().

function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_for_bus
function.description:
Like foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new() but takes a #GBusType instead of a #GDBusConnection.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_for_bus_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_for_bus_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this constructor.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_for_bus_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_for_bus().

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_for_bus().

function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_for_bus_sync
function.description:
Like foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_sync() but takes a #GBusType instead of a #GDBusConnection.
The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_for_bus() for the asynchronous version of this constructor.
function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new_sync
function.description:
Synchronously creates a proxy for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-org-project-Bar-Frobnicator.top_of_page">org.project.Bar.Frobnicator</link>. See g_dbus_proxy_new_sync() for more details.
The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See foo_igen_bar_frobnicator_proxy_new() for the asynchronous version of this constructor.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A bus name (well-known or unique) or %NULL if @connection is not a message bus connection.

function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: foo_igen_bar_get_aay
function.description:
Gets the value of the <link linkend="gdbus-property-org-project-Bar.aay">"aay"</link> D-Bus property.
Since this D-Bus property is both readable and writable, it is meaningful to use this function on both the client- and service-side.
<warning>The returned value is only valid until the property changes so on the client-side it is only safe to use this function on the thread where @object was constructed. Use foo_igen_bar_dup_aay() if on another thread.</warning>
function.return: The property value or %NULL if the property is not set. Do not free the returned value, it belongs to @object.

function.name: foo_igen_bat_call_force_method
function.description:
Asynchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-project-Bat.ForceMethod">ForceMethod()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call foo_igen_bat_call_force_method_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See foo_igen_bat_call_force_method_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this method.

parameter.name: arg_force_in_i
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_force_in_s
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_force_in_ay
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: arg_force_in_struct
parameter.parameter_description: Argument to pass with the method invocation.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or %NULL.

function.name: foo_igen_bat_call_force_method_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with foo_igen_bat_call_force_method().

parameter.name: out_force_out_i
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: out_force_out_s
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: out_force_out_ay
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: out_force_out_struct
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to foo_igen_bat_call_force_method().

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.description:
Synchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-project-Bat.ForceMethod">ForceMethod()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See foo_igen_bat_call_force_method() for the asynchronous version of this method.

parameter.name: arg_force_in_s

parameter.name: out_force_out_ay
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

parameter.name: out_force_out_struct
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.name: foo_igen_bat_complete_force_method
function.description:
Helper function used in service implementations to finish handling invocations of the <link linkend="gdbus-method-org-project-Bat.ForceMethod">ForceMethod()</link> D-Bus method. If you instead want to finish handling an invocation by returning an error, use g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() or similar.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.

function.name: foo_igen_com_acme_coyote_dup_mood
function.description:
Gets a copy of the <link linkend="gdbus-property-com-acme-Coyote.Mood">"Mood"</link> D-Bus property.
Since this D-Bus property is readable, it is meaningful to use this function on both the client- and service-side.
function.return: The property value or %NULL if the property is not set. The returned value should be freed with g_free().

function.name: foo_igen_com_acme_coyote_emit_surprised
function.description: Emits the <link linkend="gdbus-signal-com-acme-Coyote.Surprised">"Surprised"</link> D-Bus signal.

function.name: foo_igen_com_acme_coyote_get_mood
function.description:
Gets the value of the <link linkend="gdbus-property-com-acme-Coyote.Mood">"Mood"</link> D-Bus property.
Since this D-Bus property is readable, it is meaningful to use this function on both the client- and service-side.
<warning>The returned value is only valid until the property changes so on the client-side it is only safe to use this function on the thread where @object was constructed. Use foo_igen_com_acme_coyote_dup_mood() if on another thread.</warning>
function.return: The property value or %NULL if the property is not set. Do not free the returned value, it belongs to @object.

function.name: foo_igen_inline_docs_dup_baz_property
function.description:
Gets a copy of the <link linkend="gdbus-property-org-project-InlineDocs.BazProperty">"BazProperty"</link> D-Bus property.
Since this D-Bus property is readable, it is meaningful to use this function on both the client- and service-side.
function.return: The property value or %NULL if the property is not set. The returned value should be freed with g_free().

function.name: foo_igen_inline_docs_get_baz_property
function.description:
Gets the value of the <link linkend="gdbus-property-org-project-InlineDocs.BazProperty">"BazProperty"</link> D-Bus property.
Since this D-Bus property is readable, it is meaningful to use this function on both the client- and service-side.
<warning>The returned value is only valid until the property changes so on the client-side it is only safe to use this function on the thread where @object was constructed. Use foo_igen_inline_docs_dup_baz_property() if on another thread.</warning>
function.return: The property value or %NULL if the property is not set. Do not free the returned value, it belongs to @object.

Synchronously creates a proxy for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-Naming.top_of_page">Naming</link>. See g_dbus_proxy_new_sync() for more details.

function.name: foo_igen_naming_set_type_
function.description:
Sets the <link linkend="gdbus-property-Naming.Type">"Type"</link> D-Bus property to @value.
Since this D-Bus property is both readable and writable, it is meaningful to use this function on both the client- and service-side.

When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call foo_igen_object_manager_client_new_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See foo_igen_object_manager_client_new_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this constructor.

parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: foo_igen_object_peek_authorize
function.description:
Like foo_igen_object_get_authorize() but doesn't increase the reference count on the returned object.
<warning>It is not safe to use the returned object if you are on another thread than the one where the #GDBusObjectManagerClient or #GDBusObjectManagerServer for @object is running.</warning>
function.return: A #FooiGenAuthorize or %NULL if @object does not implement the interface. Do not free the returned object, it is owned by @object.

Since this D-Bus property is readable, it is meaningful to use this function on both the client- and service-side.

Synchronously invokes the <link linkend="gdbus-method-UnknownXmlTags.CanSetTimezone">CanSetTimezone()</link> D-Bus method on @proxy. The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received.
See foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_call_can_set_timezone() for the asynchronous version of this method.

parameter.name: out_value
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for return parameter or %NULL to ignore.

function.return: %TRUE if the call succeded, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_complete_can_set_timezone
function.description:
Helper function used in service implementations to finish handling invocations of the <link linkend="gdbus-method-UnknownXmlTags.CanSetTimezone">CanSetTimezone()</link> D-Bus method. If you instead want to finish handling an invocation by returning an error, use g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() or similar.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_dup_some_property
function.description:
Gets a copy of the <link linkend="gdbus-property-UnknownXmlTags.SomeProperty">"SomeProperty"</link> D-Bus property.
Since this D-Bus property is both readable and writable, it is meaningful to use this function on both the client- and service-side.
function.return: The property value or %NULL if the property is not set. The returned value should be freed with g_free().

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_emit_some_signal
function.description: Emits the <link linkend="gdbus-signal-UnknownXmlTags.SomeSignal">"SomeSignal"</link> D-Bus signal.

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_get_some_property
function.description:
Gets the value of the <link linkend="gdbus-property-UnknownXmlTags.SomeProperty">"SomeProperty"</link> D-Bus property.
Since this D-Bus property is both readable and writable, it is meaningful to use this function on both the client- and service-side.
<warning>The returned value is only valid until the property changes so on the client-side it is only safe to use this function on the thread where @object was constructed. Use foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_dup_some_property() if on another thread.</warning>
function.return: The property value or %NULL if the property is not set. Do not free the returned value, it belongs to @object.

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_interface_info
function.description: Gets a machine-readable description of the <link linkend="gdbus-interface-UnknownXmlTags.top_of_page">UnknownXmlTags</link> D-Bus interface.
function.return: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo. Do not free.

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_override_properties
function.description: Overrides all #GObject properties in the #FooiGenUnknownXmlTags interface for a concrete class. The properties are overridden in the order they are defined.

parameter.name: klass
parameter.parameter_description: The class structure for a #GObject<!-- -->-derived class.

parameter.name: property_id_begin
parameter.parameter_description: The property id to assign to the first overridden property.

function.return: The last property id.

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new
function.description:
Asynchronously creates a proxy for the D-Bus interface <link linkend="gdbus-interface-UnknownXmlTags.top_of_page">UnknownXmlTags</link>. See g_dbus_proxy_new() for more details.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this constructor.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A bus name (well-known or unique) or %NULL if @connection is not a message bus connection.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new().

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new().

function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new_for_bus
function.description:
Like foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new() but takes a #GBusType instead of a #GDBusConnection.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new_for_bus_finish() to get the result of the operation.
See foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new_for_bus_sync() for the synchronous, blocking version of this constructor.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new_for_bus_finish
function.description: Finishes an operation started with foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new_for_bus().

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: The #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new_for_bus().

function.return: The constructed proxy object or %NULL if @error is set.

function.name: foo_igen_unknown_xml_tags_proxy_new_for_bus_sync
function.description:
