This can fail if e.g. @gvalue is of type #G_TYPE_STRING and @type is 'i'. It will also fail for any #GType (including e.g. #G_TYPE_OBJECT and #G_TYPE_BOXED derived-types) not in the table above. Note that if @gvalue is of type #G_TYPE_VARIANT and its value is %NULL, the empty #GVariant instance (never %NULL) for @type is returned (e.g. 0 for scalar types, the empty string for string types, '/' for object path types, the empty array for any array type and so on). See the g_dbus_gvariant_to_gvalue() function for how to convert a #GVariant to a #GValue. Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_gvariant_to_gvalue
function.description:
Converts a #GVariant to a #GValue. If @value is floating, it is consumed.
The rules specified in the g_dbus_gvalue_to_gvariant() function are used - this function is essentially its reverse form.
The conversion never fails - a valid #GValue is always returned in @out_gvalue.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: out_gvalue
parameter.parameter_description: Return location pointing to a zero-filled (uninitialized) #GValue.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_dup_object
function.description:
Gets the #GDBusObject that @interface_ belongs to, if any.
Since: 2.32
function.return: A #GDBusObject or %NULL. The returned reference should be freed with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_interface_get_info
function.description:
Gets D-Bus introspection information for the D-Bus interface implemented by @interface_.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo. Do not free.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_get_object
function.description:
Gets the #GDBusObject that @interface_ belongs to, if any.
<warning>It is not safe to use the returned object if @interface_ or the returned object is being used from other threads. See g_dbus_interface_dup_object() for a thread-safe alternative.</warning>
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GDBusObject or %NULL. The returned reference belongs to @interface_ and should not be freed.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_info_cache_build
function.description:
Builds a lookup-cache to speed up g_dbus_interface_info_lookup_method(), g_dbus_interface_info_lookup_signal() and g_dbus_interface_info_lookup_property().
If this has already been called with @info, the existing cache is used and its use count is increased.
Note that @info cannot be modified until g_dbus_interface_info_cache_release() is called.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_interface_info_cache_release
function.description:
Decrements the usage count for the cache for @info built by g_dbus_interface_info_cache_build() (if any) and frees the resources used by the cache if the usage count drops to zero.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_interface_info_generate_xml
function.description:
Appends an XML representation of @info (and its children) to @string_builder.
This function is typically used for generating introspection XML documents at run-time for handling the <literal>org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable.Introspect</literal> method.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: string_builder
parameter.parameter_description: A #GString to to append XML data to.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_info_lookup_method
function.description:
Looks up information about a method.
The cost of this function is O(n) in number of methods unless g_dbus_interface_info_cache_build() has been used on @info.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A D-Bus method name (typically in CamelCase)

function.return: A #GDBusMethodInfo or %NULL if not found. Do not free, it is owned by @info.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_info_lookup_property
function.description:
Looks up information about a property.
The cost of this function is O(n) in number of properties unless g_dbus_interface_info_cache_build() has been used on @info.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A D-Bus property name (typically in CamelCase).

function.return: A #GDBusPropertyInfo or %NULL if not found. Do not free, it is owned by @info.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_info_lookup_signal
function.description:
Looks up information about a signal.
The cost of this function is O(n) in number of signals unless g_dbus_interface_info_cache_build() has been used on @info.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A D-Bus signal name (typically in CamelCase)

function.return: A #GDBusSignalInfo or %NULL if not found. Do not free, it is owned by @info.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_info_ref
function.description:
If @info is statically allocated does nothing. Otherwise increases the reference count.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The same @info.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_info_unref
function.description:
If @info is statically allocated, does nothing. Otherwise decreases the reference count of @info. When its reference count drops to 0, the memory used is freed.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_interface_set_object
function.description:
Sets the #GDBusObject for @interface_ to @object.
Note that @interface_ will hold a weak reference to @object.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_export
function.description:
Exports @interface_ at @object_path on @connection.
This can be called multiple times to export the same @interface_ onto multiple connections however the @object_path provided must be the same for all connections.
Use g_dbus_interface_skeleton_unexport() to unexport the object.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: object_path
parameter.parameter_description: The path to export the interface at.

function.return: %TRUE if the interface was exported on @connection, otherwise %FALSE with @error set.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_flush
function.description:
If @interface_ has outstanding changes, request for these changes to be emitted immediately.
For example, an exported D-Bus interface may queue up property changes and emit the <literal>org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties::PropertiesChanged</literal> signal later (e.g. in an idle handler). This technique is useful for collapsing multiple property changes into one.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_get_connection
function.description:
Gets the first connection that @interface_ is exported on, if any.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GDBusConnection or %NULL if @interface_ is not exported anywhere. Do not free, the object belongs to @interface_.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_get_connections
function.description:
Gets a list of the connections that @interface_ is exported on.
Since: 2.32
function.return: A list of all the connections that @interface_ is exported on. The returned list should be freed with g_list_free() after each element has been freed with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_get_flags
function.description:
Gets the #GDBusInterfaceSkeletonFlags that describes what the behavior of @interface_
Since: 2.30
function.return: One or more flags from the #GDBusInterfaceSkeletonFlags enumeration.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_get_info
function.description:
Gets D-Bus introspection information for the D-Bus interface implemented by @interface_.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo (never %NULL). Do not free.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_get_object_path
function.description:
Gets the object path that @interface_ is exported on, if any.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A string owned by @interface_ or %NULL if @interface_ is not exported anywhere. Do not free, the string belongs to @interface_.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_get_properties
function.description:
Gets all D-Bus properties for @interface_.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GVariant of type <link linkend="G-VARIANT-TYPE-VARDICT:CAPS">'a{sv}'</link>. Free with g_variant_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_get_vtable
function.description:
Gets the interface vtable for the D-Bus interface implemented by @interface_. The returned function pointers should expect @interface_ itself to be passed as @user_data.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GDBusInterfaceVTable (never %NULL).

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_has_connection
function.description:
Checks if @interface_ is exported on @connection.
Since: 2.32
function.return: %TRUE if @interface_ is exported on @connection, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_set_flags
function.description:
Sets flags describing what the behavior of @skeleton should be.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_unexport
function.description:
Stops exporting @interface_ on all connections it is exported on.
To unexport @interface_ from only a single connection, use g_dbus_interface_skeleton_unexport_from_connection()
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_interface_skeleton_unexport_from_connection
function.description:
Stops exporting @interface_ on @connection.
To stop exporting on all connections the interface is exported on, use g_dbus_interface_skeleton_unexport().
Since: 2.32

function.name: g_dbus_is_address
function.description:
Checks if @string is a D-Bus address.
This doesn't check if @string is actually supported by #GDBusServer or #GDBusConnection - use g_dbus_is_supported_address() to do more checks.
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if @string is a valid D-Bus address, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_is_guid
function.description:
Checks if @string is a D-Bus GUID.
See the D-Bus specification regarding what strings are valid D-Bus GUID (for example, D-Bus GUIDs are not RFC-4122 compliant).
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if @string is a guid, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_is_interface_name
function.description:
Checks if @string is a valid D-Bus interface name.
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if valid, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_is_member_name
function.description:
Checks if @string is a valid D-Bus member (e.g. signal or method) name.
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if valid, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_is_name
function.description:
Checks if @string is a valid D-Bus bus name (either unique or well-known).
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if valid, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_is_supported_address
function.description:
Like g_dbus_is_address() but also checks if the library suppors the transports in @string and that key/value pairs for each transport are valid.
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if @string is a valid D-Bus address that is supported by this library, %FALSE if @error is set.

function.name: g_dbus_is_unique_name
function.description:
Checks if @string is a valid D-Bus unique bus name.
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if valid, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_menu_model_get
function.description:
Obtains a #GDBusMenuModel for the menu model which is exported at the given @bus_name and @object_path.
The thread default main context is taken at the time of this call. All signals on the menu model (and any linked models) are reported with respect to this context. All calls on the returned menu model (and linked models) must also originate from this same context, with the thread default main context unchanged.
Since: 2.32

parameter.name: bus_name
parameter.parameter_description: the bus name which exports the menu model

parameter.name: object_path
parameter.parameter_description: the object path at which the menu model is exported

function.return: a #GDBusMenuModel object. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_message_bytes_needed
function.description:
Utility function to calculate how many bytes are needed to completely deserialize the D-Bus message stored at @blob.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: blob
parameter.parameter_description: A blob represent a binary D-Bus message.

parameter.name: blob_len
parameter.parameter_description: The length of @blob (must be at least 16).

function.name: g_dbus_message_copy
function.description:
Copies @message. The copy is a deep copy and the returned #GDBusMessage is completely identical except that it is guaranteed to not be locked.
This operation can fail if e.g. @message contains file descriptors and the per-process or system-wide open files limit is reached.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A new #GDBusMessage or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_arg0
function.description:
Convenience to get the first item in the body of @message.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The string item or %NULL if the first item in the body of @message is not a string.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_body
function.description:
Gets the body of a message.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GVariant or %NULL if the body is empty. Do not free, it is owned by @message.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_byte_order
function.description: Gets the byte order of @message.
function.return: The byte order.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_destination
function.description:
Convenience getter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_DESTINATION header field.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The value.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_error_name
function.description:
Convenience getter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_ERROR_NAME header field.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The value.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_flags
function.description:
Gets the flags for @message.
Since: 2.26
function.return: Flags that are set (typically values from the #GDBusMessageFlags enumeration bitwise ORed together).

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_header
function.description:
Gets a header field on @message.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: header_field
parameter.parameter_description: A 8-bit unsigned integer (typically a value from the #GDBusMessageHeaderField enumeration)

function.return: A #GVariant with the value if the header was found, %NULL otherwise. Do not free, it is owned by @message.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_header_fields
function.description:
Gets an array of all header fields on @message that are set.
Since: 2.26
function.return: An array of header fields terminated by %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_INVALID. Each element is a #guchar. Free with g_free().

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_interface
function.description:
Convenience getter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_INTERFACE header field.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The value.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_locked
function.description:
Checks whether @message is locked. To monitor changes to this value, conncet to the #GObject::notify signal to listen for changes on the #GDBusMessage:locked property.
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if @message is locked, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_member
function.description:
Convenience getter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_MEMBER header field.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The value.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_message_type
function.description:
Gets the type of @message.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A 8-bit unsigned integer (typically a value from the #GDBusMessageType enumeration).

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_num_unix_fds
function.description:
Convenience getter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_NUM_UNIX_FDS header field.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The value.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_path
function.description:
Convenience getter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_PATH header field.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The value.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_reply_serial
function.description:
Convenience getter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_REPLY_SERIAL header field.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The value.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_sender
function.description:
Convenience getter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_SENDER header field.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The value.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_serial
function.description:
Gets the serial for @message.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #guint32.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_signature
function.description:
Convenience getter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_SIGNATURE header field.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The value.

function.name: g_dbus_message_get_unix_fd_list
function.description:
Gets the UNIX file descriptors associated with @message, if any.
This method is only available on UNIX.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GUnixFDList or %NULL if no file descriptors are associated. Do not free, this object is owned by @message.

function.name: g_dbus_message_lock
function.description:
If @message is locked, does nothing. Otherwise locks the message.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_new
function.description:
Creates a new empty #GDBusMessage.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GDBusMessage. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_message_new_from_blob
function.description:
Creates a new #GDBusMessage from the data stored at @blob. The byte order that the message was in can be retrieved using g_dbus_message_get_byte_order().
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: blob
parameter.parameter_description: A blob represent a binary D-Bus message.

parameter.name: capabilities
parameter.parameter_description: A #GDBusCapabilityFlags describing what protocol features are supported.

function.return: A new #GDBusMessage or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_message_new_method_call
function.description:
Creates a new #GDBusMessage for a method call.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: interface_
parameter.parameter_description: A valid D-Bus interface name or %NULL.

function.return: A #GDBusMessage. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_message_new_method_error
function.description:
Creates a new #GDBusMessage that is an error reply to @method_call_message.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: method_call_message
parameter.parameter_description: A message of type %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_TYPE_METHOD_CALL to create a reply message to.

parameter.name: error_message_format
parameter.parameter_description: The D-Bus error message in a printf() format.

function.return: A #GDBusMessage. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_message_new_method_error_literal
function.description:
Creates a new #GDBusMessage that is an error reply to @method_call_message.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: method_call_message
parameter.parameter_description: A message of type %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_TYPE_METHOD_CALL to create a reply message to.

function.return: A #GDBusMessage. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_message_new_method_error_valist
function.description:
Like g_dbus_message_new_method_error() but intended for language bindings.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: method_call_message
parameter.parameter_description: A message of type %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_TYPE_METHOD_CALL to create a reply message to.

parameter.name: error_message_format
parameter.parameter_description: The D-Bus error message in a printf() format.

function.return: A #GDBusMessage. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_message_new_method_reply
function.description:
Creates a new #GDBusMessage that is a reply to @method_call_message.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: method_call_message
parameter.parameter_description: A message of type %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_TYPE_METHOD_CALL to create a reply message to.

function.return: #GDBusMessage. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_message_new_signal
function.description:
Creates a new #GDBusMessage for a signal emission.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GDBusMessage. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_message_print
function.description:
Produces a human-readable multi-line description of @message.
The contents of the description has no ABI guarantees, the contents and formatting is subject to change at any time. Typical output looks something like this: <programlisting> Type: method-call Flags: none Version: 0 Serial: 4 Headers: path -> objectpath '/org/gtk/GDBus/TestObject' interface -> 'org.gtk.GDBus.TestInterface' member -> 'GimmeStdout' destination -> ':1.146' Body: () UNIX File Descriptors: (none) </programlisting> or <programlisting> Type: method-return Flags: no-reply-expected Version: 0 Serial: 477 Headers: reply-serial -> uint32 4 destination -> ':1.159' sender -> ':1.146' num-unix-fds -> uint32 1 Body: () UNIX File Descriptors: fd 12: dev=0:10,mode=020620,ino=5,uid=500,gid=5,rdev=136:2,size=0,atime=1273085037,mtime=1273085851,ctime=1272982635 </programlisting>
Since: 2.26
function.return: A string that should be freed with g_free().

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_body
function.description:
Sets the body @message. As a side-effect the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_SIGNATURE header field is set to the type string of @body (or cleared if @body is %NULL).
If @body is floating, @message assumes ownership of @body.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: body
parameter.parameter_description: Either %NULL or a #GVariant that is a tuple.

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_byte_order
function.description: Sets the byte order of @message.

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_destination
function.description:
Convenience setter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_DESTINATION header field.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_error_name
function.description:
Convenience setter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_ERROR_NAME header field.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_flags
function.description:
Sets the flags to set on @message.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: Flags for @message that are set (typically values from the #GDBusMessageFlags enumeration bitwise ORed together).

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_header
function.description:
Sets a header field on @message.
If @value is floating, @message assumes ownership of @value.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: header_field
parameter.parameter_description: A 8-bit unsigned integer (typically a value from the #GDBusMessageHeaderField enumeration)

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: A #GVariant to set the header field or %NULL to clear the header field.

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_interface
function.description:
Convenience setter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_INTERFACE header field.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_member
function.description:
Convenience setter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_MEMBER header field.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_message_type
function.description:
Sets @message to be of @type.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: A 8-bit unsigned integer (typically a value from the #GDBusMessageType enumeration).

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_num_unix_fds
function.description:
Convenience setter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_NUM_UNIX_FDS header field.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_path
function.description:
Convenience setter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_PATH header field.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_reply_serial
function.description:
Convenience setter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_REPLY_SERIAL header field.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_sender
function.description:
Convenience setter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_SENDER header field.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_serial
function.description:
Sets the serial for @message.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_signature
function.description:
Convenience setter for the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_SIGNATURE header field.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_set_unix_fd_list
function.description:
Sets the UNIX file descriptors associated with @message. As a side-effect the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_NUM_UNIX_FDS header field is set to the number of fds in @fd_list (or cleared if @fd_list is %NULL).
This method is only available on UNIX.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_message_to_blob
function.description:
Serializes @message to a blob. The byte order returned by g_dbus_message_get_byte_order() will be used.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: out_size
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for size of generated blob.

parameter.name: capabilities
parameter.parameter_description: A #GDBusCapabilityFlags describing what protocol features are supported.

function.return: A pointer to a valid binary D-Bus message of @out_size bytes generated by @message or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_free().

function.name: g_dbus_message_to_gerror
function.description:
If @message is not of type %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_TYPE_ERROR does nothing and returns %FALSE.
Otherwise this method encodes the error in @message as a #GError using g_dbus_error_set_dbus_error() using the information in the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_HEADER_FIELD_ERROR_NAME header field of @message as well as the first string item in @message's body.
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if @error was set, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_method_info_ref
function.description:
If @info is statically allocated does nothing. Otherwise increases the reference count.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The same @info.

function.name: g_dbus_method_info_unref
function.description:
If @info is statically allocated, does nothing. Otherwise decreases the reference count of @info. When its reference count drops to 0, the memory used is freed.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_get_connection
function.description:
Gets the #GDBusConnection the method was invoked on.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GDBusConnection. Do not free, it is owned by @invocation.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_get_interface_name
function.description:
Gets the name of the D-Bus interface the method was invoked on.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A string. Do not free, it is owned by @invocation.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_get_message
function.description:
Gets the #GDBusMessage for the method invocation. This is useful if you need to use low-level protocol features, such as UNIX file descriptor passing, that cannot be properly expressed in the #GVariant API.
See <xref linkend="gdbus-server"/> and <xref linkend="gdbus-unix-fd-client"/> for an example of how to use this low-level API to send and receive UNIX file descriptors.
Since: 2.26
function.return: #GDBusMessage. Do not free, it is owned by @invocation.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_get_method_info
function.description:
Gets information about the method call, if any.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GDBusMethodInfo or %NULL. Do not free, it is owned by @invocation.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_get_method_name
function.description:
Gets the name of the method that was invoked.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A string. Do not free, it is owned by @invocation.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_get_object_path
function.description:
Gets the object path the method was invoked on.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A string. Do not free, it is owned by @invocation.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_get_parameters
function.description:
Gets the parameters of the method invocation. If there are no input parameters then this will return a GVariant with 0 children rather than NULL.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GVariant tuple. Do not unref this because it is owned by @invocation.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_get_sender
function.description:
Gets the bus name that invoked the method.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A string. Do not free, it is owned by @invocation.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_get_user_data
function.description:
Gets the @user_data #gpointer passed to g_dbus_connection_register_object().
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #gpointer.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_return_dbus_error
function.description:
Finishes handling a D-Bus method call by returning an error.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error
function.description:
Finishes handling a D-Bus method call by returning an error.
See g_dbus_error_encode_gerror() for details about what error name will be returned on the wire. In a nutshell, if the given error is registered using g_dbus_error_register_error() the name given during registration is used. Otherwise, a name of the form <literal>org.gtk.GDBus.UnmappedGError.Quark...</literal> is used. This provides transparent mapping of #GError between applications using GDBus.
If you are writing an application intended to be portable, <emphasis>always</emphasis> register errors with g_dbus_error_register_error() or use g_dbus_method_invocation_return_dbus_error().
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error_literal
function.description:
Like g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() but without printf()-style formatting.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error_valist
function.description:
Like g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() but intended for language bindings.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_return_gerror
function.description:
Like g_dbus_method_invocation_return_error() but takes a #GError instead of the error domain, error code and message.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_return_value
function.description:
Finishes handling a D-Bus method call by returning @parameters. If the @parameters GVariant is floating, it is consumed.
It is an error if @parameters is not of the right format.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.parameter_description: A #GVariant tuple with out parameters for the method or %NULL if not passing any parameters.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_return_value_with_unix_fd_list
function.description:
Like g_dbus_method_invocation_return_value() but also takes a #GUnixFDList.
This method is only available on UNIX.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.parameter_description: A #GVariant tuple with out parameters for the method or %NULL if not passing any parameters.

function.name: g_dbus_method_invocation_take_error
function.description:
Like g_dbus_method_invocation_return_gerror() but takes ownership of @error so the caller does not need to free it.
This method will free @invocation, you cannot use it afterwards.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_node_info_generate_xml
function.description:
Appends an XML representation of @info (and its children) to @string_builder.
This function is typically used for generating introspection XML documents at run-time for handling the <literal>org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable.Introspect</literal> method.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: string_builder
parameter.parameter_description: A #GString to to append XML data to.

function.name: g_dbus_node_info_lookup_interface
function.description:
Looks up information about an interface.
The cost of this function is O(n) in number of interfaces.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo or %NULL if not found. Do not free, it is owned by @info.

function.name: g_dbus_node_info_new_for_xml
function.description:
Parses @xml_data and returns a #GDBusNodeInfo representing the data.
The introspection XML must contain exactly one top-level <tag class="starttag">node</tag> element.
Note that this routine is using a <link linkend="glib-Simple-XML-Subset-Parser.description">GMarkup</link>-based parser that only accepts a subset of valid XML documents.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GDBusNodeInfo structure or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_dbus_node_info_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_node_info_ref
function.description:
If @info is statically allocated does nothing. Otherwise increases the reference count.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The same @info.

function.name: g_dbus_node_info_unref
function.description:
If @info is statically allocated, does nothing. Otherwise decreases the reference count of @info. When its reference count drops to 0, the memory used is freed.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_object_get_interface
function.return: %NULL if not found, otherwise a #GDBusInterface that must be freed with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_get_interfaces
function.description:
Gets the D-Bus interfaces associated with @object.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A list of #GDBusInterface instances. The returned list must be freed by g_list_free() after each element has been freed with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_get_object_path
function.description:
Gets the object path for @object.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A string owned by @object. Do not free.

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_client_get_connection
function.description:
Gets the #GDBusConnection used by @manager.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GDBusConnection object. Do not free, the object belongs to @manager.

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_client_get_flags
function.description:
Gets the flags that @manager was constructed with.
Since: 2.30
function.return: Zero of more flags from the #GDBusObjectManagerClientFlags enumeration.

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_client_get_name
function.description:
Gets the name that @manager is for, or %NULL if not a message bus connection.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A unique or well-known name. Do not free, the string belongs to @manager.

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_client_get_name_owner
function.description:
The unique name that owns the name that @manager is for or %NULL if no-one currently owns that name. You can connect to the #GObject::notify signal to track changes to the #GDBusObjectManagerClient:name-owner property.
Since: 2.30
function.return: The name owner or %NULL if no name owner exists. Free with g_free().

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_client_new
function.description:
Asynchronously creates a new #GDBusObjectManagerClient object.
This is an asynchronous failable constructor. When the result is ready, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_finish() to get the result. See g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_sync() for the synchronous version.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: Zero or more flags from the #GDBusObjectManagerClientFlags enumeration.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: The owner of the control object (unique or well-known name).

parameter.name: object_path
parameter.parameter_description: The object path of the control object.

parameter.name: get_proxy_type_func
parameter.parameter_description: A #GDBusProxyTypeFunc function or %NULL to always construct #GDBusProxy proxies.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_finish
function.description:
Finishes an operation started with g_dbus_object_manager_client_new().
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to g_dbus_object_manager_client_new().

function.return: A #GDBusObjectManagerClient object or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_for_bus
function.description:
Like g_dbus_object_manager_client_new() but takes a #GBusType instead of a #GDBusConnection.
This is an asynchronous failable constructor. When the result is ready, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_for_bus_finish() to get the result. See g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_for_bus_sync() for the synchronous version.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: Zero or more flags from the #GDBusObjectManagerClientFlags enumeration.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: The owner of the control object (unique or well-known name).

parameter.name: object_path
parameter.parameter_description: The object path of the control object.

parameter.name: get_proxy_type_func
parameter.parameter_description: A #GDBusProxyTypeFunc function or %NULL to always construct #GDBusProxy proxies.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied.

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_for_bus_finish
function.description:
Finishes an operation started with g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_for_bus().
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_for_bus().

function.return: A #GDBusObjectManagerClient object or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_for_bus_sync
function.description:
Like g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_sync() but takes a #GBusType instead of a #GDBusConnection.
This is a synchronous failable constructor - the calling thread is blocked until a reply is received. See g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_for_bus() for the asynchronous version.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: Zero or more flags from the #GDBusObjectManagerClientFlags enumeration.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: The owner of the control object (unique or well-known name).

parameter.name: object_path
parameter.parameter_description: The object path of the control object.

parameter.name: get_proxy_type_func
parameter.parameter_description: A #GDBusProxyTypeFunc function or %NULL to always construct #GDBusProxy proxies.

function.return: A #GDBusObjectManagerClient object or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_client_new_sync
function.description:
Creates a new #GDBusObjectManagerClient object.
This is a synchronous failable constructor - the calling thread is blocked until a reply is received. See g_dbus_object_manager_client_new() for the asynchronous version.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: Zero or more flags from the #GDBusObjectManagerClientFlags enumeration.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: The owner of the control object (unique or well-known name), or %NULL when not using a message bus connection.

parameter.name: object_path
parameter.parameter_description: The object path of the control object.

parameter.name: get_proxy_type_func
parameter.parameter_description: A #GDBusProxyTypeFunc function or %NULL to always construct #GDBusProxy proxies.

function.return: A #GDBusObjectManagerClient object or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_get_interface
function.description:
Gets the interface proxy for @interface_name at @object_path, if any.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GDBusInterface instance or %NULL. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_get_object
function.description:
Gets the #GDBusObjectProxy at @object_path, if any.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GDBusObject or %NULL. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_get_object_path
function.description:
Gets the object path that @manager is for.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A string owned by @manager. Do not free.

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_get_objects
function.description:
Gets all #GDBusObject objects known to @manager.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A list of #GDBusObject objects. The returned list should be freed with g_list_free() after each element has been freed with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_server_export
function.description:
Exports @object on @manager.
If there is already a #GDBusObject exported at the object path, then the old object is removed.
The object path for @object must be in the hierarchy rooted by the object path for @manager.
Note that @manager will take a reference on @object for as long as it is exported.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_server_export_uniquely
function.description:
Like g_dbus_object_manager_server_export() but appends a string of the form <literal>_N</literal> (with N being a natural number) to @object<!-- -->'s object path if an object with the given path already exists. As such, the #GDBusObjectProxy:g-object-path property of @object may be modified.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_server_get_connection
function.description:
Gets the #GDBusConnection used by @manager.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_server_is_exported
function.description:
Returns whether @object is currently exported on @manager.
Since: 2.34
function.return: %TRUE if @object is exported

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_server_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GDBusObjectManagerServer object.
The returned server isn't yet exported on any connection. To do so, use g_dbus_object_manager_server_set_connection(). Normally you want to export all of your objects before doing so to avoid <ulink url="http://dbus.freedesktop.org/doc/dbus-specification.html#standard-interfaces-objectmanager">InterfacesAdded</ulink> signals being emitted.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: object_path
parameter.parameter_description: The object path to export the manager object at.

function.return: A #GDBusObjectManagerServer object. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_server_set_connection
function.description: Exports all objects managed by @manager on @connection. If @connection is %NULL, stops exporting objects.

function.name: g_dbus_object_manager_server_unexport
function.description:
If @manager has an object at @path, removes the object. Otherwise does nothing.
Note that @object_path must be in the hierarchy rooted by the object path for @manager.
Since: 2.30
function.return: %TRUE if object at @object_path was removed, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_object_proxy_get_connection
function.description:
Gets the connection that @proxy is for.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GDBusConnection. Do not free, the object is owned by @proxy.

function.name: g_dbus_object_proxy_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GDBusObjectProxy for the given connection and object path.
Since: 2.30
function.return: a new #GDBusObjectProxy

function.name: g_dbus_object_skeleton_add_interface
function.description:
Adds @interface_ to @object.
If @object already contains a #GDBusInterfaceSkeleton with the same interface name, it is removed before @interface_ is added.
Note that @object takes its own reference on @interface_ and holds it until removed.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_object_skeleton_flush
function.description:
This method simply calls g_dbus_interface_skeleton_flush() on all interfaces belonging to @object. See that method for when flushing is useful.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_object_skeleton_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GDBusObjectSkeleton.
Since: 2.30
function.return: A #GDBusObjectSkeleton. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_object_skeleton_remove_interface
function.description:
Removes @interface_ from @object.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_object_skeleton_remove_interface_by_name
function.description:
Removes the #GDBusInterface with @interface_name from @object.
If no D-Bus interface of the given interface exists, this function does nothing.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_object_skeleton_set_object_path
function.description:
Sets the object path for @object.
Since: 2.30

function.name: g_dbus_property_info_ref
function.description:
If @info is statically allocated does nothing. Otherwise increases the reference count.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The same @info.

function.name: g_dbus_property_info_unref
function.description:
If @info is statically allocated, does nothing. Otherwise decreases the reference count of @info. When its reference count drops to 0, the memory used is freed.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_call
function.description:
Asynchronously invokes the @method_name method on @proxy.
If @method_name contains any dots, then @name is split into interface and method name parts. This allows using @proxy for invoking methods on other interfaces.
If the #GDBusConnection associated with @proxy is closed then the operation will fail with %G_IO_ERROR_CLOSED. If @cancellable is canceled, the operation will fail with %G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED. If @parameters contains a value not compatible with the D-Bus protocol, the operation fails with %G_IO_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT.
If the @parameters #GVariant is floating, it is consumed. This allows convenient 'inline' use of g_variant_new(), e.g.: |[ g_dbus_proxy_call (proxy, "TwoStrings", g_variant_new ("(ss)", "Thing One", "Thing Two"), G_DBUS_CALL_FLAGS_NONE, -1, NULL, (GAsyncReadyCallback) two_strings_done, &data); ]|
If @proxy has an expected interface (see #GDBusProxy:g-interface-info) and @method_name is referenced by it, then the return value is checked against the return type.
This is an asynchronous method. When the operation is finished, @callback will be invoked in the <link linkend="g-main-context-push-thread-default">thread-default main loop</link> of the thread you are calling this method from. You can then call g_dbus_proxy_call_finish() to get the result of the operation. See g_dbus_proxy_call_sync() for the synchronous version of this method.
If @callback is %NULL then the D-Bus method call message will be sent with the %G_DBUS_MESSAGE_FLAGS_NO_REPLY_EXPECTED flag set.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.parameter_description: A #GVariant tuple with parameters for the signal or %NULL if not passing parameters.

parameter.name: timeout_msec
parameter.parameter_description: The timeout in milliseconds (with %G_MAXINT meaning "infinite") or -1 to use the proxy default timeout.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or %NULL if you don't care about the result of the method invocation.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_call_finish
function.description:
Finishes an operation started with g_dbus_proxy_call().
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to g_dbus_proxy_call().

function.return: %NULL if @error is set. Otherwise a #GVariant tuple with return values. Free with g_variant_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_call_sync
function.description:
Synchronously invokes the @method_name method on @proxy.
If @method_name contains any dots, then @name is split into interface and method name parts. This allows using @proxy for invoking methods on other interfaces.
If the #GDBusConnection associated with @proxy is disconnected then the operation will fail with %G_IO_ERROR_CLOSED. If @cancellable is canceled, the operation will fail with %G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED. If @parameters contains a value not compatible with the D-Bus protocol, the operation fails with %G_IO_ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT.
If the @parameters #GVariant is floating, it is consumed. This allows convenient 'inline' use of g_variant_new(), e.g.: |[ g_dbus_proxy_call_sync (proxy, "TwoStrings", g_variant_new ("(ss)", "Thing One", "Thing Two"), G_DBUS_CALL_FLAGS_NONE, -1, NULL, &error); ]|
The calling thread is blocked until a reply is received. See g_dbus_proxy_call() for the asynchronous version of this method.
If @proxy has an expected interface (see #GDBusProxy:g-interface-info) and @method_name is referenced by it, then the return value is checked against the return type.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.parameter_description: A #GVariant tuple with parameters for the signal or %NULL if not passing parameters.

parameter.name: timeout_msec
parameter.parameter_description: The timeout in milliseconds (with %G_MAXINT meaning "infinite") or -1 to use the proxy default timeout.

function.return: %NULL if @error is set. Otherwise a #GVariant tuple with return values. Free with g_variant_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list
function.description:
Like g_dbus_proxy_call() but also takes a #GUnixFDList object.
This method is only available on UNIX.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.parameter_description: A #GVariant tuple with parameters for the signal or %NULL if not passing parameters.

parameter.name: timeout_msec
parameter.parameter_description: The timeout in milliseconds (with %G_MAXINT meaning "infinite") or -1 to use the proxy default timeout.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied or %NULL if you don't care about the result of the method invocation.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list_finish
function.description:
Finishes an operation started with g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list().
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback passed to g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list().

function.return: %NULL if @error is set. Otherwise a #GVariant tuple with return values. Free with g_variant_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_call_with_unix_fd_list_sync
function.description:
Like g_dbus_proxy_call_sync() but also takes and returns #GUnixFDList objects.
This method is only available on UNIX.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.parameter_description: A #GVariant tuple with parameters for the signal or %NULL if not passing parameters.

parameter.name: timeout_msec
parameter.parameter_description: The timeout in milliseconds (with %G_MAXINT meaning "infinite") or -1 to use the proxy default timeout.

function.return: %NULL if @error is set. Otherwise a #GVariant tuple with return values. Free with g_variant_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_get_cached_property
function.description:
Looks up the value for a property from the cache. This call does no blocking IO.
If @proxy has an expected interface (see #GDBusProxy:g-interface-info) and @property_name is referenced by it, then @value is checked against the type of the property.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A reference to the #GVariant instance that holds the value for @property_name or %NULL if the value is not in the cache. The returned reference must be freed with g_variant_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_get_cached_property_names
function.description:
Gets the names of all cached properties on @proxy.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_get_connection
function.description:
Gets the connection @proxy is for.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GDBusConnection owned by @proxy. Do not free.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_get_default_timeout
function.description:
Gets the timeout to use if -1 (specifying default timeout) is passed as @timeout_msec in the g_dbus_proxy_call() and g_dbus_proxy_call_sync() functions.
See the #GDBusProxy:g-default-timeout property for more details.
Since: 2.26
function.return: Timeout to use for @proxy.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_get_flags
function.description:
Gets the flags that @proxy was constructed with.
Since: 2.26
function.return: Flags from the #GDBusProxyFlags enumeration.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_get_interface_info
function.description:
Returns the #GDBusInterfaceInfo, if any, specifying the interface that @proxy conforms to. See the #GDBusProxy:g-interface-info property for more details.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo or %NULL. Do not unref the returned object, it is owned by @proxy.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_get_interface_name
function.description:
Gets the D-Bus interface name @proxy is for.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A string owned by @proxy. Do not free.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_get_name
function.description:
Gets the name that @proxy was constructed for.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A string owned by @proxy. Do not free.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_get_name_owner
function.description:
The unique name that owns the name that @proxy is for or %NULL if no-one currently owns that name. You may connect to the #GObject::notify signal to track changes to the #GDBusProxy:g-name-owner property.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The name owner or %NULL if no name owner exists. Free with g_free().

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_get_object_path
function.description:
Gets the object path @proxy is for.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A string owned by @proxy. Do not free.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_new
function.description:
Creates a proxy for accessing @interface_name on the remote object at @object_path owned by @name at @connection and asynchronously loads D-Bus properties unless the %G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_LOAD_PROPERTIES flag is used. Connect to the #GDBusProxy::g-properties-changed signal to get notified about property changes.
If the %G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_CONNECT_SIGNALS flag is not set, also sets up match rules for signals. Connect to the #GDBusProxy::g-signal signal to handle signals from the remote object.
If @name is a well-known name and the %G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_AUTO_START flag isn't set and no name owner currently exists, the message bus will be requested to launch a name owner for the name.
This is a failable asynchronous constructor - when the proxy is ready, @callback will be invoked and you can use g_dbus_proxy_new_finish() to get the result.
See g_dbus_proxy_new_sync() and for a synchronous version of this constructor.
See <xref linkend="gdbus-wellknown-proxy"/> for an example of how #GDBusProxy can be used.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: Flags used when constructing the proxy.

parameter.name: info
parameter.parameter_description: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo specifying the minimal interface that @proxy conforms to or %NULL.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A bus name (well-known or unique) or %NULL if @connection is not a message bus connection.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: Callback function to invoke when the proxy is ready.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_new_finish
function.description:
Finishes creating a #GDBusProxy.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback function passed to g_dbus_proxy_new().

function.return: A #GDBusProxy or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_new_for_bus
function.description:
Like g_dbus_proxy_new() but takes a #GBusType instead of a #GDBusConnection.
See <xref linkend="gdbus-wellknown-proxy"/> for an example of how #GDBusProxy can be used.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: Flags used when constructing the proxy.

parameter.name: info
parameter.parameter_description: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo specifying the minimal interface that @proxy conforms to or %NULL.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: Callback function to invoke when the proxy is ready.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_new_for_bus_finish
function.description:
Finishes creating a #GDBusProxy.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: res
parameter.parameter_description: A #GAsyncResult obtained from the #GAsyncReadyCallback function passed to g_dbus_proxy_new_for_bus().

function.return: A #GDBusProxy or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_new_for_bus_sync
function.description:
Like g_dbus_proxy_new_sync() but takes a #GBusType instead of a #GDBusConnection.
See <xref linkend="gdbus-wellknown-proxy"/> for an example of how #GDBusProxy can be used.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: Flags used when constructing the proxy.

parameter.name: info
parameter.parameter_description: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo specifying the minimal interface that @proxy conforms to or %NULL.

function.return: A #GDBusProxy or %NULL if error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_new_sync
function.description:
Creates a proxy for accessing @interface_name on the remote object at @object_path owned by @name at @connection and synchronously loads D-Bus properties unless the %G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_LOAD_PROPERTIES flag is used.
If the %G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_CONNECT_SIGNALS flag is not set, also sets up match rules for signals. Connect to the #GDBusProxy::g-signal signal to handle signals from the remote object.
If @name is a well-known name and the %G_DBUS_PROXY_FLAGS_DO_NOT_AUTO_START flag isn't set and no name owner currently exists, the message bus will be requested to launch a name owner for the name.
This is a synchronous failable constructor. See g_dbus_proxy_new() and g_dbus_proxy_new_finish() for the asynchronous version.
See <xref linkend="gdbus-wellknown-proxy"/> for an example of how #GDBusProxy can be used.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: Flags used when constructing the proxy.

parameter.name: info
parameter.parameter_description: A #GDBusInterfaceInfo specifying the minimal interface that @proxy conforms to or %NULL.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A bus name (well-known or unique) or %NULL if @connection is not a message bus connection.

function.return: A #GDBusProxy or %NULL if error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_set_cached_property
function.description:
If @value is not %NULL, sets the cached value for the property with name @property_name to the value in @value.
If @value is %NULL, then the cached value is removed from the property cache.
If @proxy has an expected interface (see #GDBusProxy:g-interface-info) and @property_name is referenced by it, then @value is checked against the type of the property.
If the @value #GVariant is floating, it is consumed. This allows convenient 'inline' use of g_variant_new(), e.g. |[ g_dbus_proxy_set_cached_property (proxy, "SomeProperty", g_variant_new ("(si)", "A String", 42)); ]|
Normally you will not need to use this method since @proxy is tracking changes using the <literal>org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties.PropertiesChanged</literal> D-Bus signal. However, for performance reasons an object may decide to not use this signal for some properties and instead use a proprietary out-of-band mechanism to transmit changes.
As a concrete example, consider an object with a property <literal>ChatroomParticipants</literal> which is an array of strings. Instead of transmitting the same (long) array every time the property changes, it is more efficient to only transmit the delta using e.g. signals <literal>ChatroomParticipantJoined(String name)</literal> and <literal>ChatroomParticipantParted(String name)</literal>.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Value for the property or %NULL to remove it from the cache.

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_set_default_timeout
function.description:
Sets the timeout to use if -1 (specifying default timeout) is passed as @timeout_msec in the g_dbus_proxy_call() and g_dbus_proxy_call_sync() functions.
See the #GDBusProxy:g-default-timeout property for more details.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_proxy_set_interface_info
function.description:
Ensure that interactions with @proxy conform to the given interface. See the #GDBusProxy:g-interface-info property for more details.
Since: 2.26

parameter.name: info
parameter.parameter_description: Minimum interface this proxy conforms to or %NULL to unset.

function.name: g_dbus_server_get_client_address
function.description:
Gets a D-Bus address string that can be used by clients to connect to @server.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A D-Bus address string. Do not free, the string is owned by @server.

function.name: g_dbus_server_get_flags
function.description:
Gets the flags for @server.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A set of flags from the #GDBusServerFlags enumeration.

function.name: g_dbus_server_get_guid
function.description:
Gets the GUID for @server.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A D-Bus GUID. Do not free this string, it is owned by @server.

function.name: g_dbus_server_is_active
function.description:
Gets whether @server is active.
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if server is active, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_dbus_server_new_sync
function.description:
Creates a new D-Bus server that listens on the first address in @address that works.
Once constructed, you can use g_dbus_server_get_client_address() to get a D-Bus address string that clients can use to connect.
Connect to the #GDBusServer::new-connection signal to handle incoming connections.
The returned #GDBusServer isn't active - you have to start it with g_dbus_server_start().
See <xref linkend="gdbus-peer-to-peer"/> for how #GDBusServer can be used.
This is a synchronous failable constructor. See g_dbus_server_new() for the asynchronous version.
Since: 2.26
function.return: A #GDBusServer or %NULL if @error is set. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_dbus_server_start
function.description:
Starts @server.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_server_stop
function.description:
Stops @server.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_dbus_signal_info_ref
function.description:
If @info is statically allocated does nothing. Otherwise increases the reference count.
Since: 2.26
function.return: The same @info.

function.name: g_dbus_signal_info_unref
function.description:
If @info is statically allocated, does nothing. Otherwise decreases the reference count of @info. When its reference count drops to 0, the memory used is freed.
Since: 2.26

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_get_boolean
function.description:
Looks up a boolean value in the keyfile backing @info.
The @key is looked up in the "Desktop Entry" group.
Since: 2.36
function.return: the boolean value, or %FALSE if the key is not found

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_get_categories
function.description: Gets the categories from the desktop file.
function.return: The unparsed Categories key from the desktop file; i.e. no attempt is made to split it by ';' or validate it.

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_get_filename
function.description:
When @info was created from a known filename, return it. In some situations such as the #GDesktopAppInfo returned from g_desktop_app_info_new_from_keyfile(), this function will return %NULL.
Since: 2.24
function.return: The full path to the file for @info, or %NULL if not known.

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_get_generic_name
function.description: Gets the generic name from the destkop file.
function.return: The value of the GenericName key

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_get_is_hidden
function.description: A desktop file is hidden if the Hidden key in it is set to True.
function.return: %TRUE if hidden, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_get_keywords
function.description:
Gets the keywords from the desktop file.
Since: 2.32
function.return: The value of the Keywords key

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_get_nodisplay
function.description:
Gets the value of the NoDisplay key, which helps determine if the application info should be shown in menus. See #G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_NO_DISPLAY and g_app_info_should_show().
Since: 2.30
function.return: The value of the NoDisplay key

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_get_show_in
function.description:
Checks if the application info should be shown in menus that list available applications for a specific name of the desktop, based on the <literal>OnlyShowIn</literal> and <literal>NotShowIn</literal> keys.
If @desktop_env is %NULL, then the name of the desktop set with g_desktop_app_info_set_desktop_env() is used.
Note that g_app_info_should_show() for @info will include this check (with %NULL for @desktop_env) as well as additional checks.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: desktop_env
parameter.parameter_description: a string specifying a desktop name

function.return: %TRUE if the @info should be shown in @desktop_env according to the <literal>OnlyShowIn</literal> and <literal>NotShowIn</literal> keys, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_get_startup_wm_class
function.description:
Retrieves the StartupWMClass field from @info. This represents the WM_CLASS property of the main window of the application, if launched through @info.
Since: 2.34
function.return: the startup WM class, or %NULL if none is set in the desktop file.

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_get_string
function.description:
Looks up a string value in the keyfile backing @info.
The @key is looked up in the "Desktop Entry" group.
Since: 2.36
function.return: a newly allocated string, or %NULL if the key is not found

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_has_key
function.description:
Returns whether @key exists in the "Desktop Entry" group of the keyfile backing @info.
Since: 2.26
function.return: %TRUE if the @key exists

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_launch_uris_as_manager
function.description:
This function performs the equivalent of g_app_info_launch_uris(), but is intended primarily for operating system components that launch applications. Ordinary applications should use g_app_info_launch_uris().
In contrast to g_app_info_launch_uris(), all processes created will always be run directly as children as if by the UNIX fork()/exec() calls.
This guarantee allows additional control over the exact environment of the child processes, which is provided via a setup function @user_setup, as well as the process identifier of each child process via @pid_callback. See g_spawn_async() for more information about the semantics of the @user_setup function.

parameter.name: user_setup
parameter.parameter_description: a #GSpawnChildSetupFunc, used once for each process.

function.return: %TRUE on successful launch, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_lookup_get_default_for_uri_scheme
function.description:
Gets the default application for launching applications using this URI scheme for a particular GDesktopAppInfoLookup implementation.
The GDesktopAppInfoLookup interface and this function is used to implement g_app_info_get_default_for_uri_scheme() backends in a GIO module. There is no reason for applications to use it directly. Applications should use g_app_info_get_default_for_uri_scheme().
Deprecated: The #GDesktopAppInfoLookup interface is deprecated and unused by gio.

parameter.name: uri_scheme
parameter.parameter_description: a string containing a URI scheme.

function.return: #GAppInfo for given @uri_scheme or %NULL on error.

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GDesktopAppInfo based on a desktop file id.
A desktop file id is the basename of the desktop file, including the .desktop extension. GIO is looking for a desktop file with this name in the <filename>applications</filename> subdirectories of the XDG data directories (i.e. the directories specified in the <envar>XDG_DATA_HOME</envar> and <envar>XDG_DATA_DIRS</envar> environment variables). GIO also supports the prefix-to-subdirectory mapping that is described in the <ulink url="http://standards.freedesktop.org/menu-spec/latest/">Menu Spec</ulink> (i.e. a desktop id of kde-foo.desktop will match <filename>/usr/share/applications/kde/foo.desktop</filename>).
function.return: a new #GDesktopAppInfo, or %NULL if no desktop file with that id

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_new_from_filename
function.description: Creates a new #GDesktopAppInfo.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the path of a desktop file, in the GLib filename encoding

function.return: a new #GDesktopAppInfo or %NULL on error.

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_new_from_keyfile
function.description:
Creates a new #GDesktopAppInfo.
Since: 2.18
function.return: a new #GDesktopAppInfo or %NULL on error.

function.name: g_desktop_app_info_set_desktop_env
function.description:
Sets the name of the desktop that the application is running in. This is used by g_app_info_should_show() and g_desktop_app_info_get_show_in() to evaluate the <literal>OnlyShowIn</literal> and <literal>NotShowIn</literal> desktop entry fields.
The <ulink url="http://standards.freedesktop.org/menu-spec/latest/">Desktop Menu specification</ulink> recognizes the following: <simplelist> <member>GNOME</member> <member>KDE</member> <member>ROX</member> <member>XFCE</member> <member>LXDE</member> <member>Unity</member> <member>Old</member> </simplelist>
Should be called only once; subsequent calls are ignored.

parameter.name: desktop_env
parameter.parameter_description: a string specifying what desktop this is

function.name: g_drive_can_stop

function.name: g_drive_eject
function.description:
Asynchronously ejects a drive.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be called. You can then call g_drive_eject_finish() to obtain the result of the operation.
Deprecated: 2.22: Use g_drive_eject_with_operation() instead.

function.name: g_drive_eject_finish

Finishes ejecting a drive.
Deprecated: 2.22: Use g_drive_eject_with_operation_finish() instead.
function.return: %TRUE if the drive has been ejected successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_drive_eject_with_operation
function.description:
Ejects a drive. This is an asynchronous operation, and is finished by calling g_drive_eject_with_operation_finish() with the @drive and #GAsyncResult data returned in the @callback.
Since: 2.22

parameter.name: flags

function.name: g_drive_eject_with_operation_finish

parameter.name: error

function.name: g_file_append_to
function.description:
Gets an output stream for appending data to the file. If the file doesn't already exist it is created.
By default files created are generally readable by everyone, but if you pass #G_FILE_CREATE_PRIVATE in @flags the file will be made readable only to the current user, to the level that is supported on the target filesystem.
If @cancellable is not %NULL, then the operation can be cancelled by triggering the cancellable object from another thread. If the operation was cancelled, the error %G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED will be returned.
Some file systems don't allow all file names, and may return an %G_IO_ERROR_INVALID_FILENAME error. If the file is a directory the %G_IO_ERROR_IS_DIRECTORY error will be returned. Other errors are possible too, and depend on what kind of filesystem the file is on.
function.return: a #GFileOutputStream, or %NULL on error. Free the returned object with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_file_append_to_async
function.description:
Asynchronously opens @file for appending.
For more details, see g_file_append_to() which is the synchronous version of this call.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be called. You can then call g_file_append_to_finish() to get the result of the operation.

parameter.name: io_priority
parameter.parameter_description: the <link linkend="io-priority">I/O priority</link> of the request

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: g_file_append_to_finish
function.description: Finishes an asynchronous file append operation started with g_file_append_to_async().
function.return: a valid #GFileOutputStream or %NULL on error. Free the returned object with g_object_unref().

function.name: g_file_attribute_info_list_add
function.description: Adds a new attribute with @name to the @list, setting its @type and @flags.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the attribute to add.

function.description: Makes a duplicate of a file attribute info list.
function.return: a copy of the given @list.

function.name: g_file_attribute_info_list_lookup
function.description: Gets the file attribute with the name @name from @list.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the attribute to lookup.

function.return: a #GFileAttributeInfo for the @name, or %NULL if an attribute isn't found.

function.name: g_file_attribute_info_list_new
function.description: Creates a new file attribute info list.
function.return: a #GFileAttributeInfoList.

function.name: g_file_attribute_info_list_ref
function.description: References a file attribute info list.
function.return: #GFileAttributeInfoList or %NULL on error.

function.name: g_file_attribute_info_list_unref
function.description: Removes a reference from the given @list. If the reference count falls to zero, the @list is deleted.

function.name: g_file_attribute_matcher_enumerate_namespace
function.description:
Checks if the matcher will match all of the keys in a given namespace. This will always return %TRUE if a wildcard character is in use (e.g. if matcher was created with "standard::*" and @ns is "standard", or if matcher was created using "*" and namespace is anything.)
TODO: this is awkwardly worded.

parameter.name: ns
parameter.parameter_description: a string containing a file attribute namespace.

function.return: %TRUE if the matcher matches all of the entries in the given @ns, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_file_attribute_matcher_enumerate_next
function.description: Gets the next matched attribute from a #GFileAttributeMatcher.
function.return: a string containing the next attribute or %NULL if no more attribute exist.

function.name: g_file_attribute_matcher_matches
function.description: Checks if an attribute will be matched by an attribute matcher. If the matcher was created with the "*" matching string, this function will always return %TRUE.
function.return: %TRUE if @attribute matches @matcher. %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_file_attribute_matcher_matches_only
function.description: Checks if a attribute matcher only matches a given attribute. Always returns %FALSE if "*" was used when creating the matcher.
function.return: %TRUE if the matcher only matches @attribute. %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_file_attribute_matcher_new
function.description: Creates a new file attribute matcher, which matches attributes against a given string. #GFileAttributeMatchers are reference counted structures, and are created with a reference count of 1. If the number of references falls to 0, the #GFileAttributeMatcher is automatically destroyed. The @attribute string should be formatted with specific keys separated from namespaces with a double colon. Several "namespace::key" strings may be concatenated with a single comma (e.g. "standard::type,standard::is-hidden"). The wildcard "*" may be used to match all keys and namespaces, or "namespace::*" will match all keys in a given namespace. Examples of strings to use: File Attribute Matcher strings and results Matcher String Matches "*"matches all attributes."standard::is-hidden"matches only the key is-hidden in the standard namespace."standard::type,unix::*"matches the type key in the standard namespace and all keys in the unix namespace.
function.return: a #GFileAttributeMatcher.

function.name: g_file_attribute_matcher_ref
function.description: References a file attribute matcher.
function.return: a #GFileAttributeMatcher.

function.name: g_file_attribute_matcher_subtract
function.description:
Subtracts all attributes of @subtract from @matcher and returns a matcher that supports those attributes.
Note that currently it is not possible to remove a single attribute when the @matcher matches the whole namespace - or remove a namespace or attribute when the matcher matches everything. This is a limitation of the current implementation, but may be fixed in the future.
function.return: A file attribute matcher matching all attributes of @matcher that are not matched by @subtract

function.name: g_file_attribute_matcher_to_string
function.description:
Prints what the matcher is matching against. The format will be equal to the format passed to g_file_attribute_matcher_new(). The output however, might not be identical, as the matcher may decide to use a different order or omit needless parts.
Since: 2.32
function.return: a string describing the attributes the matcher matches against or %NULL if @matcher was %NULL.

function.name: g_file_attribute_matcher_unref
function.description: Unreferences @matcher. If the reference count falls below 1, the @matcher is automatically freed.

function.name: g_file_copy
function.description:
Copies the file @source to the location specified by @destination. Can not handle recursive copies of directories.
If the flag #G_FILE_COPY_OVERWRITE is specified an already existing @destination file is overwritten.
If the flag #G_FILE_COPY_NOFOLLOW_SYMLINKS is specified then symlinks will be copied as symlinks, otherwise the target of the @source symlink will be copied.
If @cancellable is not %NULL, then the operation can be cancelled by triggering the cancellable object from another thread. If the operation was cancelled, the error %G_IO_ERROR_CANCELLED will be returned.
If @progress_callback is not %NULL, then the operation can be monitored by setting this to a #GFileProgressCallback function. @progress_callback_data will be passed to this function. It is guaranteed that this callback will be called after all data has been transferred with the total number of bytes copied during the operation.
If the @source file does not exist, then the %G_IO_ERROR_NOT_FOUND error is returned, independent on the status of the @destination.
If #G_FILE_COPY_OVERWRITE is not specified and the target exists, then the error %G_IO_ERROR_EXISTS is returned.
If trying to overwrite a file over a directory, the %G_IO_ERROR_IS_DIRECTORY error is returned. If trying to overwrite a directory with a directory the %G_IO_ERROR_WOULD_MERGE error is returned.
If the source is a directory and the target does not exist, or #G_FILE_COPY_OVERWRITE is specified and the target is a file, then the %G_IO_ERROR_WOULD_RECURSE error is returned.
If you are interested in copying the #GFile object itself (not the on-disk file), see g_file_dup().

parameter.name: progress_callback
parameter.parameter_description: function to callback with progress information, or %NULL if progress information is not needed

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: g_file_copy_async
function.description:
Copies the file @source to the location specified by @destination asynchronously. For details of the behaviour, see g_file_copy().
If @progress_callback is not %NULL, then that function that will be called just like in g_file_copy(), however the callback will run in the main loop, not in the thread that is doing the I/O operation.
When the operation is finished, @callback will be called. You can then call g_file_copy_finish() to get the result of the operation.

parameter.name: io_priority
parameter.parameter_description: the <link linkend="io-priority">I/O priority</link> of the request

parameter.name: progress_callback
parameter.parameter_description: function to callback with progress information, or %NULL if progress information is not needed

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a #GAsyncReadyCallback to call when the request is satisfied

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the data to pass to callback function

function.name: g_file_copy_attributes
function.description:
Copies the file attributes from @source to @destination.
Normally only a subset of the file attributes are copied, those that are copies in a normal file copy operation (which for instance does not include e.g. owner).
